column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 13 August 2020, the FARDC clashed with Mayi Mayi militiamen (faction not reported) in Buyonga village, near Bunyuka locality (Beni, Nord-Kivu), following a military operation against these rebels. 4 Mayi-Mayi and 1 soldier were killed. Most of the local civilians left the area. The FARDC seized several weapons and ammunition from the militiamen.
On 13 August 2020, ADF militiamen killed 4 civilians (3 young men and one 16-year-old girl) in an ambush in Makele-Kithevya village, 10 Km from Oicha (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 13 August 2020, Mayi-Mayi Kyandenga clashed with the FARDC in Kibwe village (Beni, Nord-Kivu) following an attack by the Kyandenga. 1 FARDC soldier and 4 Mai-Mai fighters were killed. 1 FARDC soldier was wounded.
On 14 August 2020, 2 rival factions of the NDC-R, led by Guidon and Bwira, fought each other in Misoke village (Walikale, Nord-Kivu). Overall, 2 fighters were killed and 3 others were wounded.

On 14 August 2020, members of local civil society organizations marched in Baraka (Fizi, Sud-Kivu) to ask for the return of MSF in the area. This INGO recently put on hold its operations in Fizi due to various attacks and kidnappings by armed groups against its staff. [size=no report]
On 14 August 2020, a group of nurses marched in Kindu (Maniema) to demand better salary conditions and the payment of bonuses. [size=no report]
On 14 August 2020, a group of nurses marched in Butembo (Lubero, Nord-Kivu) to demand better salary conditions and the payment of bonuses. [size=no report]
On 14 August 2020, a group of nurses marched in Bukavu (Sud-Kivu) to demand better salary conditions and the payment of bonuses. [size=no report]
On 14 August 2020, ADF militiamen killed 4 civilians with machetes on the main road near Mbau (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The victims were attacked when they were going to work to their fields.
On 14 August 2020, suspected ADF rebels abducted 2 people (1 man and 1 woman) in Kalitore village, near Isale (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

On 14 August 2020, a group of local people spontaneously marched towards the FARDC station in Cantine (Beni, Nord-Kivu) to show their outrage for the death of a fellow neighbor who had been shot and killed by 1 FARDC soldier. They marched carrying the body of the victim. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 14 August 2020, the FARDC clashed with ADF militia combatants in Mbokou village, near Eringeti (Beni, Nord-Kivu) following an offensive by the FARDC against a group of rebels. 2 ADF militiamen were killed and 2 FARDC soldiers were wounded.

column7: Ebola Response Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column9: Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo); ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent
column17: On 15 August 2020, Ebola response workers demonstrated in Mbandaka (Equateur) to demand their hazard pay. They gathered in front of the hospital, where they burned tires and set on fire a tent of the Red Cross. The police intervened and arrested some people. [size=no report]

column6: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 15 August 2020, Twiganeho militiamen clashed with Mayi-Mayi armed men from an unidentified faction in Bijombo (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu), resulting in 4 people killed, including a child IDP. The clash was linked to long-standing ethnic based disputes over land and cattle rustling.

column8: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column9: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: Around 15 August 2020 (month of), a group of 63 Mayi-Mayi fighters of the Mazembe group surrendered to the MONUSCO and FARDC in Kanyabayonga (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), following the death of their leader, Kitete Bushu. The rebels, who left the bush sporadically, handed over more than 20 weapons.

column6: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column17: On 15 August 2020, FPIC armed men killed at least 7 people, including 5 children, during an attack in Murubia village, within Bahema Irumu chieftaincy, near Balanzana village (Irumu, Ituri). They also looted and torched several houses and stole more than 200 cows.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 15 August 2020, a group of young people gathered in front of the provincial parliament in Kindu (Mainema) and tried to prevent some deputies from accessing into the building, where a motion of no confidence against the governor was about to be discussed. The police intervened by firing teargas and live bullets at the group, killing 1 man and injuring several other people, 4 of them seriously. Several people were also arrested. [size=at least 5]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-); PPRD: Peoples Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
column17: On 15 August 2020, unidentified armed men shot and killed the provincial deputy after breaking into his house in Matadi (Kongo-Central). The assailants also beat and injured one of the sons of the victim when he tried to help his father. The victim was from the PPRD (Peoples Party for Reconstruction and Democracy), the party of the former president Joseph Kabila.

column7: PPRD: Peoples Party for Reconstruction and Democracy
column17: On 15 August 2020, local people, many of them associated with the PPRD (Peoples Party for Reconstruction and Democracy), marched and barricaded the main road with burning tires in Mbanza Ngungu (Kongo-Central). They demonstrated to show their outrage in reaction to the killing of the provincial deputy by unidentified armed men the previous night. The politician was from this town. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 15 August 2020, FARDC soldiers clashed with ADF militiamen in Kpolowu village (Beni, Nord-Kivu), following an offensive by the army to prevent these rebels from crossing towards Ituri province. The clash resulted in 2 ADF rebels killed and 2 soldiers seriously wounded.
On 15 August 2020, ADF militiamen killed 8 civilians (4 women and 4 men) during an attack in Mwenda village (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The local survivors fled towards Mutwanga.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 16 August 2020, unidentified people set 2 school buildings on fire in Nyunzu town (Nyunzu, Tanganyika). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: FNL-N: National Forces of Liberation (Nzabampema Faction)
column17: On 16 August 2020, FNL Nzabampema armed men raped a 16-year-old girl in Mwaba (Uvira, Sud-Kivu).

column6: FNL-N: National Forces of Liberation (Nzabampema Faction)
column17: On 16 August 2020, FNL Nzabampema armed men kidnapped 5 civilians, including 2 students, in an area near Ndunda (Uvira, Sud-Kivu). They later demanded a 4,000 USD ransom for their release.

column7: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
column9: ECIDE: Engagement for Citizenship and Development; LC: Lamuka Coalition
column17: On 16 August 2020, a group of men associated with the UDPS party chased and beat the president of the ECIDE party, which is part of the Lamuka Coalition party, in Kananga (Kasai-Central). The assailants reportedly assaulted the man because he had announced his candidacy to run for governor. [size=no report]

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Union of Patriots for the Defense of the Innocents)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 16 August 2020, around 10 UPDI militiamen armed with rifles clashed with the police in Kanyabayonga (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), following an attack by these rebels against a police station. 1 policeman was shot and killed by the assailants, who also stole 1 weapon.

column6: FNL-N: National Forces of Liberation (Nzabampema Faction)
column17: On 16 August 2020, the FNL-Nzabampema kidnapped 2 men in Mwaba village (Uvira, Sud-Kivu). The kidnappers demanded a ransom of 4,000 USD for the hostages' release.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 16 August 2020, a group of local civilians confronted FARDC soldiers over a dispute in Rugetsi (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The FARDC opened fire and accidentally set on fire a police station. One of the locals stole a weapon from the FARDC and fired it. 2 men were arrested by the state forces. No fatalities and/or injuries reported. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 16 August 2020, 1 FARDC soldier shot and killed 2 civilian men during a dispute in Beni town (Nord-Kivu). The state forces launched a search operation to arrest the soldier, who ran away.

Around 16 August 2020 (from 4 - 28 August), more than 25,000 people fled their homes in Bakuankenge locality, 20 Km from Kakenge (Mweka, Kasai), and found refuge in schools in neighboring localities as a result of communal violence occurred in early August.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 16 August 2020, suspected CODECO combatants shot and killed 3 men (2 of them taxi drivers) during an ambush against 9 travellers on the main road in Damblo village, near Mongbwalu (Djugu, Ituri). The survivors sought refuge in the forest.

On 16 August 2020, Mayi Mayi Yakutumba militiamen clashed with Mayi-Mayi Biloze Bishambuke armed men in the forest of Ekengya Bulembo, near Namisha (Fizi, Sud-Kivu), following an offensive by the Yakutumba. The clash resulted in between 8 and 17 fighters killed and several injured from both sides. Many civilians sought refuge into the forest. The clash was caused by cattle rustling by the Biloze Bishambuke.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 16 August 2020, 10 Raia Mutomboki Wemba Mabala clashed with 1 FARDC soldier during an incursion by these rebels in Mitala village (Shabunda, Sud-Kivu). The assailants killed the soldier and another man. They also stole motorcycles, 1 weapon, money and other goods form the population.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Front of Patriots for Peace)
column17: On 16 August 2020, Mayi-Mayi FPP Kabido armed men clashed with the NDC-R (Guidon faction) in Fatua village (Lubero, Nord-Kivu), following an offensive by the FPP Kabido. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) FDP People's Defense Forces
column7: CMC-FNLD: Collective Movement for Change-Front for National Liberation and Democracy
column17: On 17 August 2020, the Nyatura FDP (under the CMC alliance) killed 2 men in Burambo village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). The victims, who had been abducted by these rebels, were accused of collaborating with the state forces.

column7: Ebola Response Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 17 August 2020, health workers responding to both the coronavirus and Ebola epidemics demonstrated in Bolenge (Equateur) to demand their unpaid bonuses and hazard pay. They gathered in front of the hospital where they burned tires and barricaded the main entries of the building. [size=no report]

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 17 August 2020, 485 fighters from the NDC-R armed group, including its leader Gilbert Bwira, surrendered to the FARDC in Kashuga (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). They handed over around 90 weapons. This happened just a month after Bwira attempted to overthrow the group's former leader Guidon, whose faction remain active in the bush.

On 17 August 2020, Mayi Mayi Yakutumba militiamen clashed with Mayi-Mayi Biloze Bishambuke armed men for the second straight day in the forest of Ekengya Bulembo, near Namisha (Fizi, Sud-Kivu), following an offensive by the Yakutumba. The clash was caused by cattle rustling. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column9: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-); Taxi Drivers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 17 August 2020, a group of suspected Mayi Mayi Raia Mutomboki shot and killed 1 FARDC soldier and his taxi driver during an ambush near Kidodobo (Kabare, Sud-Kivu).

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 17 August 2020, 1 policeman shot and killed 1 woman in the Kimbaseke district of Kinshasa (Kinshasa). Reportedly, she was killed following a dispute because she did not wear a face mask. Local authorities in this city had just made wearing face-mask mandatory due to the coronavirus pandemic.

On 17 August 2020, a group of taxi drivers demonstrated in Bunia (Irumu, Ituri) to show their outrage for the killing of 2 fellow taxi drivers by CODECO the previous day. They carried around the bodies of the victims before being transferred to the morgue. [size=no report]

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 17 August 2020, CODECO militia combatants shot and killed 1 civilian man on the main road in Mongbwalu village (Djugu, Ituri).

On 17 August 2020, a group of local people took to the streets in Beni (Nord-Kivu) in reaction to the killing of 2 men by 1 FARDC soldier the previous night. The locals, who carried the body of one of the victims, barricaded some streets with rocks and caused some property damage. [size=no report]

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 17 August 2020, CODECO militiamen armed with firearms and machetes killed 3 civilians (2 men and 1 woman) during an incursion in Penge village, a mining site near Kilo (Djugu, Ituri). The victims, who were artisanal miners, were beheaded with machetes. The local survivors sought refuge in the forest.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) FDP People's Defense Forces
column9: CMC-FNLD: Collective Movement for Change-Front for National Liberation and Democracy
column17: On 17 August 2020, unidentified armed men clashed with the Nyatura FDP (under the CMC alliance) in Burambo village (Nyiragongo, Nord-Kivu). 4 Nyatura FDPs fighters were killed in the clash.

column6: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: On 18 August 2020, APCLS fighters clashed with the NDC-R (Bwira faction) in the village of Lwibo (Masisi, Nord-Kivu), following an offensive by the APCLS. The NDC-R repelled the APCLS fighters. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 18 August 2020, unidentified people set 4 school buildings on fire in Lengwe (Nyunzu, Tanganyika). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 18 August 2020, FARDC soldiers clashed with ADF militiamen on the main road near Mbau (Beni, Nord-Kivu), following an offensive by the army. After an exchange of fire the FARDC repelled the ADF. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 18 August 2020, ADF armed men clashed with the FARDC on the Mbau-Kamago road, near Mamunjoma (Beni, Nord-Kivu), following an attack by these rebels. 4 civilians (2 taxi drivers) and 2 FARDC soldiers were killed in the clash.

column6: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Around 18 August 2020 (as reported), Twiganeho militiamen killed 1 child in Bijombo (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu) during an attack against a group of herders. The assailants reportedly stole 90 cows.

column6: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: On 18 August 2020, APCLS fighters clashed with the NDC-R (Bwira faction) in the village of Kilambo (Masisi, Nord-Kivu), following an offensive by the APCLS. The NDC-R repelled the APCLS fighters. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 19 August 2020, Batwa ethnic militiamen armed with firearms and arrows killed 2 FARDC soldiers and seriously wounded 2 others during an ambush near Bendera (Kalemie, Tanganyika).

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 19 August 2020, ADF militiamen clashed with the FARDC in Bahatsa (Beni, Nord-Kivu), during an offensive by these rebels against a military post. 3 rebels were killed in the clash.

column6: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 19 August 2020, local Batwa ethnic militias clashed each other in Matongo village, within Nord-Lukuga region (Nyunzu, Tanganyika) following an incursion by one of these militias. Several people were injured and several houses were torched. State forces arrived later on to re-establish order. The clash was reportedly caused by one militia accusing the other of leading peaceful cohabitation with Bantu people.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column9: Catholic Christian Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 19 August 2020, CODECO militiamen armed with firearms and machetes killed 1 civilian man during an attack on a Catholic parish church in Kilo (Djugu, Ituri). The victim was a worker of the church. The local residents fled the area towards nearby villages.

On 19 August 2020, ADF militiamen armed with firearms and machetes killed 13 civilians, including 3 women, during an attack in Matiba village (Beni, Nord-Kivu). At least 7 residents also went missing. 4 additional lifeless bodies (3 men and 1 woman) were found in the area on 24 August, raising the death toll to 17.

On 19 August 2020, a group of suspected Mayi Mayi Raia Mutomboki shot and killed 1 man during an ambush on a vehicle near Kidodobo (Kabare, Sud-Kivu). The assailants looted the other survivors of the vehicle.

column7: Batwa Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 19 August 2020, Batwa Mayi-Mayi Hapa Na Pale militiamen shot and killed 11 people and shot and injured 8 others in Kako locality, on the Lulimba-Bendera road, near Lukolo village (Kabambare, Maniema). The attackers, who had set up a barricade on this road, intercepted a vehicle and summarily executed the passengers. The death toll was said to be provisional.

On 20 August 2020, thousands of people participated in a LUCHA-led demonstration in Kananga town (Kasai-Central), asking for the international community to support the victims of the massacres committed by Kamuina Nsapu militia and other actors, and guarantee that the perpetrators will be brought to justice. They handed over a memorandum to MONUSCO. [size=thousands]

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 20 August 2020, 12 combatants from the Thoms militia, active in Kailo territory, surrendered to the FARDC in the Lomami National ParK, near Kailo (Kailo, Maniema). They handed over 2 weapons.

On 20 August 2020, a group of local people barricaded the main road in Runingu (Uvira, Sud-Kivu) with burning tires. They accused the authorities of corruption for not having disbursed 20,000 USD from a humanitarian fund allocated to support the survivors of April 2020 floods. [size=no report]

On 20 August 2020, a group of local people barricaded the main road in Kiliba (Uvira, Sud-Kivu) with burning tires. They accused the authorities of corruption for not having disbursed 20,000 USD from a humanitarian fund allocated to support the survivors of the floods occurred in April 2020. [size=no report]

column7: UNC: Union for the Congolese Nation
column17: On 20 August 2020, several hundreds of members and supporters of the UNC party (Union for the Congolese Nation) gathered in Kinshasa (Kinshasa, Kinshasa) in support of their leader Vital Kamerhe the day before his appeal in court. They then carried out a religious prayer to implore his freedom. Kamerhe was sentenced to 20 years in prison for corruption. [size=several hundreds]

On 20 August 2020, a group of local people barricaded the main road in Sange (Uvira, Sud-Kivu) with burning tires. They accused the authorities of corruption for not having disbursed 20,000 USD from a humanitarian fund allocated to support the survivors of April 2020 floods. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column17: Around 20 August 2020 (as reported), the FARDC clashed with suspected FPIC (Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo) militiamen in Kunda village (Irumu, Ituri), following an operation by the army. The FARDC captured 5 rebels. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 21 August 2020, the FARDC clashed with unidentified militiamen in the neighboring villages of Mugadja and Kihande (Uvira, Sud-Kivu), following an offensive by the FARDC. 3 soldiers were wounded and 8 rebel fighters were captured by the FARDC.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Makama Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 21 August 2020, 5 unidentified armed men carrying firearms and machetes abducted 1 village chief in Makama, 6 Km from Sebele village (Fizi, Sud-Kivu). The victim was released hours later. The assailants also looted goats and other goods.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 21 August 2020, a group of unidentified armed men carrying edged weapons and firearms killed 1 man (burned to death) and seriously injured many other civilians during an incursion into Munzambayi village, within Baswaga chieftaincy (Lubero, Nord-Kivu). The attackers looted several houses and stole cows.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 21 August 2020, an unidentified armed group abducted and killed 1 man, member of LUCHA, in Kenge (Kenge, Kwango). The victim was one of the organizers of a recent protest against the governor of the province.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 21 August 2020, the FARDC clashed with unidentified militiamen in the neighboring villages of Mugadja and Kihande (Uvira, Sud-Kivu), following an offensive by the FARDC. 3 soldiers were wounded and 8 rebel fighters were captured by the FARDC.

column6: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 22 August 2020, Ngumino armed men abducted 3 men in Katongo village (Fizi, Sud-Kivu) during an incursion in which they stole 300 cows.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 22 August 2020, the FARDC clashed with Mayi Mayi rebels from the Dragon faction in Babugho village, near Manguredjpa (Lubero, Nord-Kivu). The FARDC drove the rebels out of this village and took full control. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: Around 22 August 2020 (as reported), FARDC soldiers clashed with APCLS combatants in Lwibo (Masisi, Nord-Kivu), after an attack in which the rebels torched houses of locals. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
Around 22 August 2020 (as reported), Mayi-Mayi Yakutumba militiamen kidnapped 1 aid worker from the INGO War Child in Lumwe village (Fizi, Sud-Kivu).
On 22 August 2020, a group of Mayi-Mayi (unidentified faction) looted a gold mining site called Djugu Dopi, near Bafwabango (Mambasa, Ituri). They stole gold, money and other goods from miners.

On 22 August 2020, thousands of members and supporters of the Lamuka coalition party marched the streets of Kinshasa city (Kinshasa, Kinshasa) to show their support to their leaders Martin Fayulu and Adolphe Muzito, the day they arrived in the country from the United States. [size=thousands]

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
column9: Fishermen (Democratic Republic of Congo); Prisoners (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 22 August 2020, military forces of Uganda arrested and tortured 3 Congolese fishermen in the eastern part of Lake Edward, near Nyakakoma village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). Reportedly, the fishermen were arrested for illegally fishing in Ugandan waters.
Around 22 August 2020 (as reported), 3 people were killed in an ADF ambush along the Mbau-Kamango road section, near Mbau (Beni, Nord Kivu). The victims were civilians returning from their farms.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 22 August 2020, ADF militiamen clashed with the FARDC on the main road near Mbau (Beni, Nord-Kivu) after an offensive by the ADF. The army repelled the rebels using heavy and light weapons and eventually controlled the area. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column7: FNL-N: National Forces of Liberation (Nzabampema Faction)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 22 August 2020, a group of Mayi-Mayi Makanaki and FNL-N armed men clashed with the FARDC near Uvira town (Uvira, Sud-Kivu), following simultaneous attacks by these rebels against some FARDC positions. The army managed to repel the rebels. At least 2 FARDC soldiers were injured.

column6: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
column17: On 23 August 2020, FDLR-RUD armed men kidnapped 1 man in Kabarose village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). The kidnappers demanded a ransom of 10,000 USD for the hostage's release.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 23 August 2020, a group of Mayi-Mayi militiamen shot and killed 1 FARDC soldier after abducting him in Kamutobe village, near Kikuvo (Lubero, Nord-Kivu).

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Miners (Democratic Republic of Congo); Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 23 August 2020, unidentified armed men in police uniforms shot and killed 1 woman and seriously injured 3 other people during an attack in the mining site of Rukaza, near Rubaya town (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). Although the causes of this incident remain unknown, this area has been the scene of recurrent attacks linked to mining and ethnic-based conflicts.

On 23 August 2020, a group of local people barricaded the main road with burning tires in Panzi town (Bukavu, Sud-Kivu), demonstrating against the killing of 2 civilians by alleged armed bandits the previous night. [size=no report]

Around 23 August 2020 (from 22 - 25 August), thousands of residents of Masosi, Manzali, Kazimoto and Mambamuke villages fled towards Oicha center (Beni, Nord-Kivu). This mass displacement followed clashes between the FARDC and the ADF militia on the Mbau-Kamango road section.
On 24 August 2020, Mayi-Mayi Yakutumba armed men shot and killed a shepherd during an incursion on a farm in Kibanga village (Fizi, Sud-Kivu). The attackers also stole and killed cows.

On 24 August 2020, a group of people marched in Nkamuna locality (Songololo, Kongo-Central) against the excessive cost imposed by the national electricity and water companies and its deficient services in this territory. [size=no report]

column6: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
column17: On 24 August 2020, UPLC armed men clashed with armed men of the National Lumumbist Resistance, led by a certain Mille Tours Par Seconde, in Mawusa village, near Manguredjpa (Bepere, Lubero). 3 persons were killed and several others injured.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) FDP People's Defense Forces
column9: CMC-FNLD: Collective Movement for Change-Front for National Liberation and Democracy
column17: On 24 August 2020, the FARDC clashed with the Nyatura FDP (under the CMC alliance) in the village of Bushobyo (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), following an offensive by the FARDC. The latter drove the Nyatura FDP out of this village. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) FDP People's Defense Forces
column9: CMC-FNLD: Collective Movement for Change-Front for National Liberation and Democracy
column17: On 24 August 2020, the FARDC clashed with the Nyatura FDP (under the CMC alliance) in the villages of Mudugudu, Kinyankuku, Gashavu, all within Bwito chieftaincy near Bushobyo (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), following an offensive by the FARDC. The latter drove the Nyatura FDP out of these villages. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 24 August 2020, a group of local people marched in Kasika village (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu) to demand justice and reparations for the victims during the commemoration of the massacre by the RCD (Congolese Rally for Democracy), which took place in this village in 1998. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column17: Around 24 August 2020 (as reported), the FARDC clashed with FPIC (Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo) militiamen in Kabarole (Irumu, Ituri), following an operation by the army. The FARDC soldiers, who drove the rebels out of these villages, killed 8 combatants and recovered weapons and ammunition. Fatalities split across two events on this day in Kabarole and Sota.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column17: Around 24 August 2020 (as reported), the FARDC clashed with FPIC (Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo) militiamen in the neighboring villages of Sota, near Kabarole (Irumu, Ituri), following an operation by the army. The FARDC soldiers, who drove the rebels out of these villages, killed 8 combatants and recovered weapons and ammunition. Fatalities split across 2 events in Sota and Kabarole.

column7: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
column17: On 24 August 2020, several members of the UDPS marched in Kasumbalesa town (Sakania, Haut-Katanga) to demand the dismissal of the party's Secretary General amidst power disputes to preside this party in this province. [size=several]

On 24 August 2020, ADF militiamen killed 3 people during an incursion in Mapasana village, near Mamove (Beni, Nord-Kivu). This was one of the various attacks targeting civilians in the area of Mamove on 24 and 25 August.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 24 August 2020, Mayi Mayi militiamen led by a man called Angelus and armed with edged weapons clashed with the police in Mangina (Beni, Nord-Kivu), following an attack by these rebels against a police station. The policemen shot at the assailants and repelled them. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 24 August 2020, unidentified men armed with firearms and machetes raped 3 girls from the same family, aged 13, 15 and 20 in Mongbwalu (Djugu, Ituri). The assailants also looted goods from the victim's house.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
column17: On 24 August 2020, unidentified armed militiamen clashed with the Mayi-Mayi UPLC Kilalo in Mausa village (Lubero, Nord-Kivu), during an attack by these unidentified men. 2 Mayi-Mayi UPLC Kilalo fighters and 1 of the armed men were killed in the clash. The attackers stole 2 weapons.
On 24 August 2020, 4 Mayi-Mayi Buhirwha armed men kidnapped 2 men near Kabwiba village (Uvira, Sud-Kivu). The kidnappers stole money and phones and then demanded ransom for the hostages' release.

column6: Mudima Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Buanga Mfuamba Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 25 August 2020, 2 groups of residents from Mudima and Buanga Mfuamba villages armed with edged weapons clashed with one another in both villages, located in Luiza territory (Kasai-Central). 13 villagers were injured, some of them seriously, and around 20 houses from both villages were burned down. The clash was triggered by an old land conflict.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) FDP People's Defense Forces
column9: CMC-FNLD: Collective Movement for Change-Front for National Liberation and Democracy
column17: On 25 August 2020, the FARDC clashed with the Nyatura FDP (under the CMC alliance) in Rubeha village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), following an FARDC offensive. The FARDC stole 22 cows and goods from the local population. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) FDP People's Defense Forces
column9: CMC-FNLD: Collective Movement for Change-Front for National Liberation and Democracy
column17: On 25 August 2020, the FARDC clashed with the Nyatura FDP (under the CMC alliance) in Kitumba village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), following a military operation by the FARDC. A 12-year-old girl was wounded in the clash. The FARDC stole goods from the local population.

On 25 August 2020, around 10 members of the civil society collective Congo Amani ni Leo marched the streets in Goma (Nord-Kivu) to demand urgent action to stop violence in the Beni region and the political fragmentation across the east. They also asked the UN mission to be more offensive and not merely an observer. [size=around 10]

On 25 August 2020, ADF militiamen killed 28 people during incursions in Maitiki (11), Mabuho (6) and Babila (17) villages, at 12 Km from Mamove locality (Beni, Nord-Kivu). This was one of the various attacks targeting civilians in the area of Mamove on 24 and 25 August.

column8: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 25 August 2020, Mayi-Mayi Ebu Ela and Biloze Bishambuke clashed with Ngumino and Makanika fighters in Kitasha village (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu), following an attack by the Ebu Ela-Biloze. A 10-year-old boy was killed and a woman was injured. They drove the Ngumino and Makanika fighters out of this village.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) FDP People's Defense Forces
column9: CMC-FNLD: Collective Movement for Change-Front for National Liberation and Democracy
column17: On 26 August 2020, the FARDC clashed with the Nyatura FDP (under the CMC alliance) in Gashavu (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu) and neighbouring villages, following an attack by the army. Overall in the attack in this and other nearby villages, 2 FARDC soldiers were killed and 5 were wounded, and 3 Nyatura fighters were wounded. The FARDC burned 64 houses and looted goods. Fatalities coded across 2 events.

On 26 August 2020, 15 Raia Mutomboki Donat fighters abducted 3 people (a woman, her husband, and her 15-year-old daughter) during a raid in Kisenya village (Shabunda, Sud-Kiuv). The attackers forced the victims to carry the loot, made of several farm animals and phones.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column9: Batwa Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 26 August 2020, FARDC forces clashed with Batwa Hapa Na Pale militiamen in Misoyi and Kilumba villages, both within Nord-Lukuga chieftaincy (Nyunzu, Tanganyika). The FARDC drove the militia out of these villages. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 26 August 2020, CODECO militia combatants clashed with the FARDC in Bambu village (Djugu, Ituri) following an incursion by these rebels. The incursion took place while local students were taking the final exam of primary studies, forcing some students to leave the school. The FARDC finally drove the rebels out of the town. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Ngoma Masanga Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Ngoma Masanga Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 26 August 2020, 2 family clans clashed over a power conflict in Ngoma Masanga village, 90 Km from Kindu town (Kindu, Maniema). 2 women were seriously injured and 6 houses were torched. The police intervened and reestablished order.

On 26 August 2020, a group of people demonstrated in Oicha (Beni, Nord-Kivu) and publicly refused to accept food from a government delegation to distribute food. They claimed that the government needs to stop the violence in the region, not to give food. [size=no report]

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Limete Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 26 August 2020, the police clashed with 26 members of a communal militia in Limete (Kinshasa), during a police operation. After an exchange of fire, the police fired teargas and eventually managed to arrest the members. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) FDP People's Defense Forces
column9: CMC-FNLD: Collective Movement for Change-Front for National Liberation and Democracy
column17: On 26 August 2020, the FARDC clashed with the Nyatura FDP (under the CMC alliance) in Gashavu and the neighboring villages of Kinjugu, Kazuba, Shonyi, Mashiga, Muko and Kavumu (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), during an attack by the army. Overall in the attack, 2 FARDC soldiers were killed, 5 were wounded and 3 Nyatura fighters were also wounded. The FARDC burned 64 houses and looted goods. Fatalities coded across 2 events.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 27 August 2020, 20 members of Lucha civil society movement marched in Goma (Nord-Kivu) to demand the dismissal of the mayor due to increasing insecurity and violence in the city. The police intervened and arrested all of them. They were released few hours later. [size=20]
On 27 August 2020, a group of local people killed 1 man (burned to death) in Kyondo (Beni. Nord-Kivu). The victim was accused of theft. [size=no report]

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column16: La Prunelle; Actualite; Radio Okapi; Bunia Actualite; Twitter
column17: On 27 August 2020, CODECO militiamen killed 5 people during an attack in a mining site called Chaba, within Ndo-Okebo chieftaincy, near Kandoi (Aru, Ituri). The assailants also abducted 41 persons and looted and destroyed more than 500 houses. One of the victims was the manager of the mine.
Around 27 August 2020 (as reported), a group of retired people marched in Lubumbashi city to demand the payment of their pensions by their former employers. [size=no report]

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 27 August 2020, CODECO militiamen looted more than 100 cows from a local pastoralist in Bedu-Ezekere village (Djugu, Ituri). The FARDC chased and recovered all the cattle the day after without finding any resistance.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column9: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column16: Radio Okapi; Actualite; La Prunelle; MNCTV Congo
column17: On 27 August 2020, UPC armed men (Union of Congolese Patriots) led by Mahachano and Bahati Kibira Kapasi clashed with the FARDC and police during an incursion by the group in Katanga village, near Ngoi (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). 3 people were killed, including 1 student, 1 shepherd and 1 militia combatant. 2 other civilians were seriously injured. Other sources said that at least 5 students were killed and others went missing, including teachers. The militia attack took place while more than 300 students were taking the final exam of primary studies, forcing them to flee towards the forest.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
column17: On 27 August 2020, the FARDC clashed with FDLR-RUD armed men during an operation in Bukombo (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). Several rebels were killed, including the militia leader, Leon Mpirinya, alias Kagoma. The FARDC, who drove the rebels out of the area, recovered weapons and ammunition from the FDLR-RUD camps. The clashes left 59 houses burned and 1,299 households displaced. Unknown fatalities coded as 10. Fatalities coded across 2 events in Nyabanira and Bukombo.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
column17: On 27 August 2020, the FARDC clashed with FDLR-RUD armed men during an operation in Nyabanira (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). Several rebels were killed, including the militia leader, Leon Mpirinya, alias Kagoma. The FARDC, who drove the rebels out of the area, recovered weapons and ammunition from the FDLR-RUD camps. The clashes left 59 houses burned and 1,299 households displaced. Unknown fatalities coded as 10. Fatalities coded across 2 events in Nyabanira and Bukombo.
On 28 August 2020, ADF militia combatants armed with firearms and machetes killed 2 farmers in Mukakira village, near Matiba (Beni, Nord-Kivu).
On 28 August 2020, a group of local people stoned to death a man in Beni town (Beni, Nord-Kivu). He was accused of stealing farm animals. [size=no report]

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 28 August 2020, CODECO armed militiamen looted 56 cows from local pastoralists in Baboa-Bakoe chieftaincy, near Miala village (Irumu, Ituri).

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 28 August 2020, a group of Mayi-Mayi Kyandenga clashed with the police in Kyondo (Beni, Nord-Kivu), following an incursion by these rebels. The rebels shot and injured 1 police element and stole his weapon before leaving.

On 28 August 2020, around 20 members of Lucha civil society movement marched in Tshikapa town (Kamonia, Kasai) against the excessive cost of electricity meters imposed by a Belgian electricity company. [size=around 20]

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 28 August 2020, the Islamic State armed with heavy weapons clashed with an FARDC convoy on the main road in Kitaura village, near Matiba (Beni, Nord-Kivu), following an ambush by these rebels. They launched 1 rocket at 2 FARDC vehicles, with 8 soldiers and 2 ADF rebels killed in the ensuing clash. Other sources said that at least 10 rebels were killed. Between 7 and 8 soldiers were injured and many ADF fighters were also injured. During the clash, some ADF men killed at least 4 civilians who were in the fields nearby (3 women and 1 man).

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 28 August 2020, a mob of local civilians killed 1 FARDC soldier using sticks and stones in Mukwija village (Kalehe, Sud-Kivu). They killed the soldier in response for the killing of another villager by this soldier. Other sources said that the soldier had committed suicide just before being stoned by the mob. [size=no report]

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 29 August 2020, ADF militia combatants clashed with the FARDC in Kainama (Beni, Nord-Kivu), during an incursion in which they killed 1 civilian man.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 29 August 2020, a group of FARDC soldiers took the streets and shot at bystanders and in the air in Kirumba (Lubero, Nord-Kivu), injuring some of them. The attack was in reaction to an earlier attack against a fellow soldier by unknown armed men.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column9: Women (Democratic Republic of Congo); Taxi Drivers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Around 29 August 2020 (as reported), CODECO militia combatants attacked a woman and her motorcyclist taxi driver in Tchomia (Djugu, Ituri). No more details reported. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column7: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column17: Around 29 August 2020 (as reported), CODECO and FPIC militia combatants armed with assault weapons killed 3 people in the village of Walu (Irumu, Ituri). They also looted a local medical facility and solar panels.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column7: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column17: Around 29 August 2020 (as reported), CODECO and FPIC militia combatants armed with assault weapons carried out simultaneous incursions in the villages of Bangiana, Banigasowa, Gangu and Badia, within Djugu territory (Ituri). They systematically looted from the population, breaking into houses and killing animals. The local population fled towards the forest.

column7: PNEC: National Party for Congo's New Energy; JLNK: Structure of Young leaders of North Kivu
column17: On 29 August 2020, members of the PNEC party (National Party for Congo's New Energy) together with youth from the JLNK (Structure of Young leaders of North Kivu) marched in Kinshasa (Kinshasa, Kinshasa) to demand peace in the Kivu provinces. [size=no report]

column6: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 30 August 2020, FDLR-RUD militia combatants clashed with the FARDC in Majengo village, near Busanza (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu) following an attack against a military camp by these rebels. 10 FARDC soldiers were killed. The rebel offensive was in reaction to the killing of the leader of this group by the FARDC on 27 August.

column6: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 30 August 2020, FDLR-RUD armed men clashed with the FARDC in Rugarama village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), following an offensive by these rebels. They killed 1 FARDC soldier and wounded another. They also stole 3 weapons.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 30 August 2020, FARDC soldiers robbed goods from 1 man during an incursion in Isale (Beni, Nord-Kivu). They also threatened him with raping his children.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 30 August 2020, the FARDC clashed with ADF militiamen in the forest near Matiba (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The FARDC managed to destroy 2 ADF camps and drove them out of the area. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Students (Democratic Republic of Congo); Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 30 August 2020, a group of unidentified armed men raped 1 girl during an incursion in Isiro town (Rungu, Haut-Uele). The assailants broke into a building where 30 students were hosted to undertake final primary school test. Other sources said that 10 girls were raped. They also robbed phones and other goods from the students.

On 31 August 2020, ADF militiamen shot and killed 1 taxi driver and then torched his motorbike during an ambush on the main road near Maleki (Beni, Nord-Kivu). Some local civilians reportedly went missing after the attack.

column9: Manyama Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 31 August 2020, Mayi Mayi militiamen (from an unknown group) armed with machetes killed the local chief of Manyama village (Mambasa, Ituri) during an incursion into this village.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 31 August 2020, unidentified armed men attacked and injured several patients during an attack in a medical center in Numbi (Kalehe, Sud-Kivu). The assailants also robbed several goods from the center before going back to the forest.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 31 August 2020, FARDC soldiers clashed with unidentified armed men in Masina village, near Numbi (Kalehe, Sud-Kivu), during an attempt by these assailants to attack a medical center for the second time. The FARDC shot dead 2 assailants.

column6: Lioti-Lokori Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Yofeko Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 31 August 2020, a group of people armed with edged weapons from Lioti-Lokori village clashed with other locals in neighboring Yofeko village (Yahuma, Tshopo). 5 people were killed and other 10 were wounded in the clash. The communal violence was triggered by accusations over the death of a local prominent man by poisoning.

On 31 August 2020, the local population gathered in Bulambo village (Beni, Nord-Kivu) to show their rejection to a new FARDC post in the football field of this village. They handed over a memorandum to the local authorities stating that they feel more protected with the police. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 31 August 2020, FARDC armed men shot and injured 1 man in Vurondo village (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column6: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Mayi Mayi Militia (Makanika); Mayi Mayi Militia (Android); Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Banyamulenge Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column16: AFP; Actualite; Radio Okapi; 7 Sur 7; Kivu Security Tracker; La Prunelle
column17: On 31 August 2020, Banyamulenge militiamen from the Ngumino, Twiganeho and Android groups, led by Rukundo Makanika, clashed for about 3 hours with local Mayi-Mayi armed men in the neighboring villages of Ngezi and Bilalombili (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu), during an attack by the Ngumino/Twiganeho. The FARDC also intervened. The Ngumino/Twiganeho reportedly raped 1 girl and killed between 7 and 10 civilians (including 4 women and 3 children). 8 civilians and 1 FARDC soldier were wounded. They also stole 100 cows and other animals and torched 250 houses. The local civilians fled towards Mikenge and more than 700 students could not undertake the final primary school-leaving exam. Fatalities split between two events in Ngezi and Bilalombili.

column6: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Mayi Mayi Militia (Makanika); Mayi Mayi Militia (Android); Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Banyamulenge Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column16: Actualite; 7 Sur 7; La Prunelle; Kivu Security Tracker; Radio Okapi; AFP
column17: On 31 August 2020, Banyamulenge militiamen from the Ngumino, Twiganeho and Android groups, led by Rukundo Makanika, clashed for about 3 hours with local Mayi-Mayi armed men in the neighboring villages of Ngezi and Bilalombili (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu), during an attack by the Ngumino/Twiganeho. The FARDC also intervened. The Ngumino/Twiganeho reportedly raped 1 girl and killed between 7 and 10 civilians (including 4 women and 3 children). 8 civilians and 1 FARDC soldier were wounded. They also stole 100 cows and other animals and torched 250 houses. The local civilians fled towards Mikenge and more than 700 students could not undertake the final primary school-leaving exam. Fatalities split between two events in Ngezi and Bilalombili.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column17: On 31 August 2020, the FARDC took control of the area of Murubia, a stronghold of the FPIC rebel group, 8 Km from Walu (Irumu, Ituri), during an offensive operation against this armed group, which had left the area. The army dismantled the rebel's camp and seized several weapons and ammunition, without any clash reported.

On 1 September 2020, a group of people blocked the main Bukavu-Mugogo road, near Bukavu (Bukavu, Sud-Kivu), to show their outrage for the killing of a driver by unknown armed men the previous night. They denounced the rise of attacks by bandits on this road. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 1 September 2020, 1 FARDC soldier shot and injured 1 civilian man in Mavivi village (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The perpetrator had previously tried to steal the victim's phone.

column6: Bakua Lonji Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-); Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Bakua Tshimuna Tshimpanga Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 1 September 2020, local armed people from Bakua Lonji village (Kasai Oriental) clashed with other armed locals in Bakua Tshimuna Tshimpanga, near Tshikula (Dibaya, Kasai-Central). FARDC soldiers and policemen were reportedly involved in the fight. 1 person was killed and 5 others were injured. The clash was prompted by a land conflict.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Special Forces
column8: Private Security Forces (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 1 September 2020, the FARDC (Commandos of the Rapid Reaction Force) clashed with the personal guards of a Colonel called Frank Kaminja in Minembwe (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu), following an attack by the FARDC. One of the guards was wounded. No more details reported.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: Around 1 September 2020 (as reported), CODECO militiamen attacked and injured 3 pastoralist men near Bogoro (Irumu, Ituri). CODECO also stole 11 cows from local pastoralists in Lodja-Kripe village on the Bogoro-Tchomia road

On 1 September 2020, a group of contractors employed by the IOM (International Organization for Migration) demonstrated in Butembo city (Lubero, Nord-Kivu) to claim their unpaid salaries of the last 5 months. The IOM claimed that they were no longer employed. [size=no report]

column6: Mugalie Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Pastoralists (Democratic Republic of Congo); Fulani Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 1 September 2020, an armed communal group abducted 2 Fulani pastoralist men and stole their donkey near Mugalie village (Ango, Bas-Uele). The victims were released later on undressed.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 1 September 2020, CODECO militia combatants shot and killed 1 FARDC element on the main road 10 Km from Kasenyi village (Irumu, Ituri). The assailants ambushed the soldier and his moto taxi driver. The latter managed to escape unharmed.

column6: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 2 September 2020, the Twiganeho and the Ngumino militias clashed with the FARDC in the village of Kitavi (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu), following an attack by these rebels. Across the attacks in this village and in Biziba, 5 rebels were killed, 1 was captured and 7 were wounded. 2 civilian men were also wounded. The assailants also stole goods. Fatalities coded across 2 events.
On 2 September 2020, a group of locals captured and killed 1 man accused of robbery in Kirumba (Lubero, Nord-Kivu). [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 2 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with ADF armed men on the Mbau-Kamango road (Km. number 16), near Mamunjoma village (Beni, Nord-Kivu), as part of continued military operations against these rebels. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 2 September 2020, 2 unidentified armed men dressed in military and civilian attire raped a woman in her field 3 km west of Kapili village (Dungu, Haut-Uele).

column6: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 2 September 2020, FPIC armed men clashed with FARDC soldiers in Walu village (Irumu, Ituri), following an incursion by this rebel group. The clash resulted in 8 FPIC fighters and 2 FARDC soldiers killed. The rebels managed to loot several goods from the local residents, who fled towards the forest. The FARDC seized a significant amount of ammunition from the rebels.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column17: On 2 September 2020, FARDC soldiers clashed with FPIC armed men in an unspecified mining area of Mambasa territory (Ituri), during a military operation against these rebels. The army killed 2 FPIC rebels and seized some weapons.

column6: Banda Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 2 September 2020, a local communal militia armed with machetes and rifles attacked a group of Fulani people in their camp, 2 km south of Banda locality (Ango, Bas-Uele). The security forces intervened to stop the attack. 4 Fulani people were killed (their bodies were discovered in the bush around the area) and 1 Fulani woman went missing.

On 2 September 2020, ADF armed men killed 3 men when they were working in their fields in Tsotsora village, 4 Km from Halungupa locality (Beni, Nord-Kivu). Another man was shot and injured but managed to escape.

column6: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 2 September 2020, the Twiganeho and the Ngumino militias clashed with the FARDC in the village of Biziba (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu), during an attack by these rebels. Across attacks in this village and in Kitavi, 5 rebels were killed, 1 was captured and 7 were wounded. 2 civilian men were also wounded. The assailants also stole goods. Fatalities coded across 2 events.

On 3 September 2020, NDC-R armed men (Guidon faction) killed 1 woman in Itondo village, 2 Km from Pinga locality (Walikale, Nord-Kivu). She was accused of spying on this militia on behalf of the NDC-R of Bwira.
On 3 September 2020, a group of local people captured and beat to death 1 man accused of theft in Kalemie (Kalemie, Tanganyika). [size=no report]

column7: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Prison Guards
column17: On 3 September 2020, prison guards gathered in front of the central prison of Bukavu (Bukavu, Sud-Kivu) to oppose the sale of a building which they claimed belongs to the prison complex. [size=no report]

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 3 September 2020, a group of locals captured and lynched 4 men accused of robbery in Kipese (Lubero, Nord-Kivu). The police intervened to disperse the crowd and shot and killed 1 man during the confrontation. [size=no report]

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 3 September 2020, CODECO militiamen killed 1 civilian during an incursion in Lajunga village, 12 Km from Bunia town (Irumu, Ituri). They robbed more than 100 cows from the local population.

column6: Bena Nshimba Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Bena Kapuya Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Bena Muembia Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 3 September 2020, local people armed with edged weapons from Bena Nshimba village clashed with locals in Bena Kapuya and Bena Muembia villages, in Katanda territory (Kasai-Oriental). The clashes, triggered by a land conflict and which lasted 3 days, ended up with 11 people killed, 7 seriously injured and 924 houses burned down. Fatalities coded across 3 events.

column7: UPDS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
column9: ECIDE: Engagement for Citizenship and Development
column17: On 3 September 2020, a group of UPDS members broke into an office of the ECIDE party in Limete (Kinshasa, Kinshasa) and took several flags and other objects. They also threatened the people in the office. This incident took place after increasing tensions between the leadership of these parties. [size=no report]

column6: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Banyamulenge Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 3 September 2020, Banyamulenge Ngumino armed men killed 1 man in Kitavi village (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu). No more details were reported.

column6: FNL-N: National Forces of Liberation (Nzabampema Faction)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 3 September 2020, Burundian FNL-N rebel combatants (Nzabampema Faction) with other Mayi-Mayi allies clashed with the FARDC in Mulenge village (Uvira, Sud-Kivu), following a rebel attack against FARDC positions. 2 FARDC soldiers and 3 militia fighters were killed. 2 other rebels were arrested and 2 assault weapons seized by the FARDC.

column6: FNL-N: National Forces of Liberation (Nzabampema Faction)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 3 September 2020, Burundian FNL-N rebel combatants (Nzabampema Faction) with other Mayi-Mayi allies clashed with the FARDC in Katobo village (Uvira, Sud-Kivu), following a rebel attack against military positions. 3 Burundian combatants and their Mayi-Mayi allies were killed and 2 others were arrested by the army.

column6: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Mayi Mayi Militia (Makanika); Banyamulenge Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 3 September 2020, Ngumino and Twiganeho militiamen led by Rukundo Makanika clashed with the FARDC in Bidegu I village (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu), following an attack by these rebels. At least 15 men were killed from both sides in this and other neighboring villages. Fatalities coded across 4 events.

On 3 September 2020, thousands of supporters, including women victims of sexual violence, marched in Bukavu (Bukavu, Sud-Kivu) to denounce the death threats against the Nobel laureate Dr. Denis Mukwege. They called on the national and international authorities to guarantee his protection. Mukwege and his family received death threats in recent weeks after he called for justice over serious human rights violations in Minembwe area. [size=thousands]

column6: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Banyamulenge Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 3 September 2020, Ngumino and Twiganeho militiamen led by Rukundo Makanika clashed with the FARDC in Kalingi village (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu), following an attack by these rebels. The FARDC managed to repel the rebels. At least 15 men were killed from both sides in this and other neighboring villages. Fatalities coded across 4 events.

column6: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Mayi Mayi Militia (Makanika); Banyamulenge Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 3 September 2020, Ngumino and Twiganeho militiamen led by Rukundo Makanika clashed with the FARDC in Kalundu village (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu), following an attack by these rebels. At least 15 men were killed from both sides in this and other neighboring villages. Fatalities coded across 4 events.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 3 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with ADF militiamen on the main Mbau-Kamango road, near Matiba village (Beni, Nord-Kivu), during military operations against this rebel group. The army killed 3 ADF men and recovered several weapons. 1 FARDC soldier was injured.

column6: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Mayi Mayi Militia (Makanika); Banyamulenge Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 3 September 2020, Ngumino and Twiganeho militiamen led by Rukundo Makanika clashed with the FARDC in Minembwe village (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu). At least 15 men were killed from both sides in this and other neighboring villages. Fatalities coded across 4 events.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 3 September 2020, CODECO militia rebels armed with machetes killed 2 pastoralist men (beheaded) during an incursion in Ngida village (Irumu, Ituri).

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 4 September 2020, the FARDC chased and clashed with CODECO militiamen in Mbetsi village, near Tchomia (Djugu, Ituri), after these rebels had looted around 300 cows from local pastoralists. The FARDC recovered 200 cows. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 4 September 2020, the NDC-R under Guidon shot and killed 1 man in Muira village (Walikale, Nord-Kivu). The killers accused the victim of collaborating with the NDC-R of the Bwira wing.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 4 September 2020, unidentified militiamen killed 1 man in Baraka town (Fizi, Sud-Kivu). The attackers also stole 50 cows.

On 4 September 2020, the 2 factions of NDC-R clashed in the village of Misoke (Walikale, Nord-Kivu). Across the clash in this village and another in Mutongo, 15 fighters were killed and 5 were wounded, and 1 civilian man was killed. Fatalities coded across 2 events.

column6: Bena Nshimba Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Bena Kapuya Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Bena Muembia Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 4 September 2020, local people armed with edged weapons from Bena Nshimba village clashed with locals in Bena Kapuya and Bena Muembia villages, in Katanda territory (Kasai-Oriental) for the second straight day. The clashes, triggered by a land conflict and which lasted 3 days, ended up with 11 people killed, 7 seriously injured and 924 houses burned down. Fatalities coded across 3 events.

On 4 September 2020, ADF militiamen shot and killed 2 men and shot and injured 1 woman during an incursion in Kisuhi village and looted cattle in Ibanda Semuliki, both near Kainama (Beni, Nord-Kivu). They also destroyed properties.

column8: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column9: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 4 September 2020, some youths gathered in front of the central prison of Bunia (Irumu, Ituri) and confronted a group of around 100 CODECO militiamen armed with firearms and batons who had just carried out an incursion in this city to demand the release of their jailed peers. The police, heavily deployed to avoid clashes between the groups, fired teargas to disperse the angry youths, who called for popular resistance to protect the city from the militiamen. 5 militiamen and 2 residents were injured during the altercation (including 1 child). The CODECO rebels finally agreed to be escorted back to their villages by the FARDC. [size=no report]
On 4 September 2020, NDC-R armed men (Bwira faction) shot and killed a man in Mutongo village (Walikale, Nord-Kivu). The killers accused the victim of collaborating with the faction of NDC-R Guidon.
On 4 September 2020, local residents killed 1 man (burned to death) in Katanga locality (Fizi, Sud-Kivu). He was accused of theft after stealing chickens. [size=no report]

column7: LUCHA: Fight for Change; Raiya na Simama
column17: On 4 September 2020, around 20 members of LUCHA and Raiya na Simama civil society movements marched in Goma (Goma, Nord-Kivu). They demanded the dismissal of the mayor, who they accused of incompetence in addressing the increasing insecurity of the city. [size=around 20]

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 4 September 2020, ADF militia combatants clashed with the FARDC in Kitimba village, near Kainama (Beni, Nord-Kivu), following an incursion by these rebels in which they attacked a health center. The FARDC finally repelled the attackers. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 4 September 2020, ADF militia combatants clashed with the FARDC in Kakuka village (Beni, Nord-Kivu), during an incursion by these rebels in which they shot and killed 2 women and abducted several others civilians. The FARDC finally repelled the attackers.

column7: LUCHA: Fight for Change; Filimbi Movement
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 4 September 2020, more than 50 members of LUCHA and Filimbi demonstrated in Kinshasa (Kinshasa, Kinshasa) against the Rwandan ambassador, who they accused of denying a massacre during the Second Congo war. The police fired teargas to disperse the march before it reached the Rwandan embassy. 2 activists were seriously injured after inhaling tear gas and being beaten by police, others were arrested. The police chief confirmed some protesters were hurt, but said injuries were not serious. [size=more than 50]

On 4 September 2020, the 2 factions of NDC-R clashed in the village of Mutongo (Walikale, Nord-Kivu). Across the attack in this village and another in Misoke, 15 fighters were killed and 5 were wounded, and 1 civilian man was killed. Fatalities coded across 2 events.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: Around 5 September 2020 (as reported), 2 FARDC soldiers shot and killed 1 man in the city of Butembo (Lubero, Nord-Kivu). The attack took place after a dispute triggered by a land conflict. The perpetrators were arrested by their superiors.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 5 September 2020, the ADF clashed with the FARDC in Kisui village (Beni, Nord-Kivu), following an attack by these rebels. A house was destroyed by a rocket propelled grenade by the ADF. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 5 September 2020, armed Mayi-Mayi militiamen abducted 1 man, a member of the local Civil Society, in the Ruwenzori area of Beni territory (Nord-Kivu). The perpetrators asked a ransom for the victim's release.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 5 September 2020, 2 FARDC soldiers shot and killed 1 man near Kainama village (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column9: Bena Muembia Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)

The clashes, triggered by a land conflict and which lasted 3 days, ended up with 11 people killed, 7 seriously injured and 924 houses burned down. Fatalities coded across 3 events.

column7: Structure of Engaged Youth; Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 5 September 2020, a group comprised of members of Structure of Engaged Youth and other civil society movements, as well as journalists, marched in front of the government building in Kinshasa (Kinshasa, Kinshasa), denouncing the violence in the east of the country. The police charged at the demonstrators to disperse the group without further incidents. [size=no report]

column6: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: On 5 September 2020, APCLS militia combatants killed 2 men in Ndeko village, 0.5 Km from Lukweti village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). These rebels accused the victims of collaborating with the NDC-R armed group.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 5 September 2020, hundreds of students marched in Bukavu (Bukavu, Sud-Kivu) to show their outrage for the killing of a fellow student by robbers. The students, who deplored the insecurity in this town, blocked one main road and then tried to reach the authorities to hand over a memorandum. The police charged at the demonstrators using teargas to disperse the crowd. [size=hundreds]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 5 September 2020, FARDC soldiers kidnapped 2 men near Kanzenze village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). The soldiers, who had robbed their vehicle, demanded a ransom of 5,000 USD for the hostages' release. They also stole 100 USD and a phone from the victims.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 5 September 2020, CODECO militiamen broke into some houses where they looted several goods and goats in Mbandoni village, near Kasenyi (Irumu, Ituri).

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column9: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 6 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with 1 Mayi-Mayi combatant and 2 others in Mikenge (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu). The rebel, a former FARDC element who had recently joined a local Mayi-Mayi militia led by Kibukila Wa Seba, was shot dead by the FARDC. The other 2 armed men were also killed and 2 civilians were seriously injured in the crossfire.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
column17: On 6 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with FDLR-FOCA milita combatants in Kigarama village, 0.5 Km from Rubare village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), where these rebels were trying to kidnap a man. The FARDC drove off the rebels. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 6 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi UPLC Kilalo clashed with unidentified armed men in Singyambale village (Lubero, Nord-Kivu), following an attack by the UPLC Kilalo. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 6 September 2020, armed men from an unidentified militia clashed with the police in Baraka (Fizi, Sud-Kivu) during an attack by these rebels against a police station. 1 police was shot dead and 6 prisoners were freed by the assailants, who also looted the station.

On 6 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi armed men (unknown faction) kidnapped 7 fishermen on Lake Edward near Birwa village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). The kidnappers seized some pirogues and demanded a ransom of 525 USD for the hostages' release.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) FDP People's Defense Forces
column9: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy; CMC-FNLD: Collective Movement for Change-Front for National Liberation and Democracy
column17: Around 6 September 2020 (as reported), the FARDC regained control of the village of Kibwe, near Mashango (Masisi, Nord-Kivu), after clashing with Nyatura FDP (under CMC alliance) and FLDR-RUD militiamen. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 7 September 2020, a group of people who worked more than 15 years for a mining company demonstrated in Mbuji Mayi city (Mbuji Mayi, Kasai-Oriental) to show their outrage for the hiring of new workers by this company, after they were fired alleging bankruptcy. The ex-workers harassed the new workers by breaking into the hospital where medical exams were being taken. [size=no report]
On 7 September 2020, ADF rebels killed between 4 and 6 civilians, including at least 1 woman, during an incursion in Halungupa locality (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 7 September 2020, a group of CODECO militia combatants ambushed 2 male farmers and shot and killed 1 of them in Saikpa village, near Zekere village (Djugu, Ituri), 10 Km east of Bunia town. The other survivor managed to escape.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 7 September 2020, a mob of local people captured and killed 1 policeman by burning him alive in Kindu (Kindu, Maniema). The victim was accused of having killed a taxi driver the same night. The police intervened and arrested several people. [size=at least several]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
column17: On 7 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with the FDLR-RUD in the village of Kibende (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), after an offensive by the state forces. The FDLR-RUD resisted by repelling the FARDC. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
column17: On 7 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with the FDLR-RUD in the village of Mugomba, near Kibende (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), following an offensive by the state forces. The FDLR-RUD resisted by repelling the FARDC. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 7 September 2020, 290 Burundian refugees demonstrated in the border town of Kavimvira (Uvira, Sud-Kivu) to demand their prompt repatriation to Burundi. They also denounced the bad conditions in which they live in the camp. [size=290]

column8: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Mayi Mayi Militia (Makanika)
column17: On 7 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi Ebu Ela armed men clashed with Ngumino, Twiganeho and Makanika fighters in the village of Kiziba (Fizi, Sud-Kivu). Overall in this clash and another in Kitavi, 6 fighters were killed among the Ngumino and their allies, and 2 men were killed. The assailants also stole cows and burned houses. Fatalities coded across 2 events.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 7 September 2020, CODECO militia combatants clashed with FARDC soldiers in Bambu (Djugu, Ituri), following an offensive by these rebels against an FARDC post. 2 soldiers were shot and injured and 1 of them died later on in the hospital.
