column9: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Mayi Mayi Militia (Makanika)
column17: On 7 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi Ebu Ela armed men clashed with Ngumino, Twiganeho and Makanika fighters in the village of Kitavi (Fizi, Sud-Kivu). Overall in this clash and another in Kiziba, 6 fighters were killed among the Ngumino and their allies, and 2 men were killed. The assailants also stole cows and burned houses. Fatalities coded across 2 events.

column9: Banyamulenge Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 8 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi Kibukila militiamen and other allies (Babembe and Bafuliru ethnic groups) carried out simultaneous attacks targeting Banyamulenge people in various villages including Kabingo (Fizi, Sud-Kivu). Overall, 5 Banyamulenge civilians were killed in these and in other villages. Fatalities coded across 3 events.

column7: Babembe Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Bafuliru Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Banyamulenge Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 8 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi Kibukila militiamen and other allies (Babembe and Bafuliru ethnic groups) carried out simultaneous attacks targeting Banyamulenge people in various villages including Kahwela (Fizi, Sud-Kivu). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column9: Banyamulenge Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 8 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi Kibukila militiamen and other allies (Babembe and Bafuliru ethnic groups) carried out simultaneous attacks targeting Banyamulenge people in the villages of Bwarara, Musingi, Gashasha and Kakangara, all near Minembwe (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu). Overall, 5 Banyamulenge civilians were killed in these and other villages. Fatalities coded across 3 events.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 8 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi armed militiamen (unspecified faction) clashed for about 30 minutes with the FARDC in Oicha (Beni, Nord-Kivu), following an attack by these rebels against a military post. The FARDC managed to repel the Mayi-Mayi. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column7: Babembe Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Bafuliru Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Banyamulenge Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 8 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi Kibukila militiamen and other allies (Babembe and Bafuliru ethnic groups) carried out simultaneous attacks targeting Banyamulenge people in various villages including Rutigita (Fizi, Sud-Kivu). Overall, 5 Banyamulenge civilians were killed in these and in other villages. Fatalities coded across 3 events.

On 8 September 2020, ADF militia rebels armed with machetes and firearms killed 3 civilians during an incursion in Keti village, near Tshabi locality (Irumu, Ituri), close to the border with Nord-Kivu province. Around 200 local survivors fled towards Bahema Boga area. ADF rebels also abducted several local civilians during an incursion in Ngundugudu village, also in the Tshabi area (Irumu, Ituri).

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) FDP People's Defense Forces
column9: CMC-FNLD: Collective Movement for Change-Front for National Liberation and Democracy
column17: On 8 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with Nyatura FDP forces (under the CMC alliance and from the Turarambiwe faction) in Rugari village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). All the activities were paralyzed. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 8 September 2020 , the FARDC shot and killed 1 man in Kingarame village (Nyiragongo, Nord-Kivu). No more details were reported.
On 8 September 2020, a group of local men beat to death an 85-year-old woman in Irango locality (Beni, Nord-Kivu). She was accused of being behind the death of another man. [size=no report]

On 8 September 2020, 290 Burundian refugees demonstrated at the border, near Kamanyola town (Walungu, Sud-Kivu), to demand their repatriation to Burundi despite the closure of the border imposed since the coronavirus pandemic. They denounced the bad conditions in which they live in the transit camps. Some demonstrators tried to cross the border between by force. [size=290]

column6: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: Around 8 September 2020 (as reported), around half of the FRPI (Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri) ex-combatants who had joined the disarmament process left the demobilization camp in Azita village, within Walendu Bindi chieftaincy (Irumu, Ituri). Reportedly, these men and their families returned to the bush and took their arms again due to lack of food and basic support in the camp.

On 8 September 2020, a group of people who worked more than 15 years for a mining company demonstrated for the second straight day in Mbuji Mayi city (Mbuji Mayi, Kasai-Oriental) to show their outrage for the hiring of new workers by this company, after they were fired alleging bankruptcy. The ex-workers harassed the new workers by breaking into the hospital where medical exams were being taken. [size=no report]

On 8 September 2020, a group of local people set up barricades on the main road in Kibumba village (Nyiragongo, Nord-Kivu), interrupting the traffic throughout the morning, in reaction to the killing of a neighbor by an FARDC soldier the previous night. [size=no report]

column17: On 8 September 2020, unidentified armed men clashed with the Nyatura FDP (under the CMC alliance) in Bubuye village, 0.5 Km from Rugari locality (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), during an ambush by these unknown men.The FDLR-FOCA supported the Nyatura following the reinforcement of the attackers' ranks by M23 fighters. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 9 September 2020, a group of people who worked more than 15 years for a mining company demonstrated for the third straight day in Mbuji Mayi city (Mbuji Mayi, Kasai-Oriental) to show their outrage for the hiring of new workers by this company, after they were fired alleging bankruptcy. The ex-workers harassed the new workers by breaking into the hospital where medical exams were being taken. [size=no report]

column6: Baniari Tchabi Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column16: Actualite; AFP; Radio Okapi; MNCTV Congo
column17: On 9 September 2020, local people armed with machetes killed between 8 and 12 civilians (many of them beheaded) during an incursion in Belu village (Irumu, Ituri), close to the border with Nord-Kivu province. The victims were all Hutus. The attack was linked to intercommunal conflicts but the facts were not clear. A brigade from MONUSCO was sent to the scene along with FARDC troops to investigate the attack.

column7: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kibukila); Babembe Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Bafuliru Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Mayi Mayi Militia (Android); Mayi Mayi Militia (Makanika); Banyamulenge Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 9 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi Mutetezi militiamen led by Kibukila (Babembe and Bafuliru ethnic groups) clashed with Banyamulenge ethnic militias led by Makanika (Ngumino, Twiganeho and Android) in Bijombo village (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu), following simultaneous attacks at various villages by the Mutetezi. Overall, 18 Banyamulenge fighters were killed and 41 injured. 1 Mayi-Mayi Mutetezi was killed and 2 were injured. At least 800 cows were stolen by the Mayi-Mayi assailants, who drove the Banyamulenge out of the village. Fatalities coded across 5 events.

column7: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kibukila); Babembe Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Bafuliru Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Mayi Mayi Militia (Android); Mayi Mayi Militia (Makanika); Banyamulenge Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 9 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi Mutetezi militiamen led by Kibukila (Babembe and Bafuliru ethnic groups) clashed with Banyamulenge ethnic militias led by Makanika (Ngumino, Twiganeho and Android) in the village of Cakira (Fizi, Sud-Kivu), following simultaneous attacks at various villages by the Mutetezi. Overall, 18 Banyamulenge fighters were killed and 41 injured. 1 Mayi-Mayi Mutetezi was killed and 2 were injured. At least 800 cows were stolen by the Mayi-Mayi assailants, who drove the Banyamulenge out of these villages. Fatalities coded across 5 events.

column7: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kibukila); Babembe Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Bafuliru Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Mayi Mayi Militia (Android); Mayi Mayi Militia (Makanika); Banyamulenge Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 9 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi Mutetezi militiamen led by Kibukila (Babembe and Bafuliru ethnic groups) clashed with Banyamulenge ethnic militias led by Makanika (Ngumino, Twiganeho and Android) in the villages of Bijabo and Nyamaramara, near Cakira (Fizi, Sud-Kivu), following simultaneous attacks at various villages by the Mutetezi. Overall, 18 Banyamulenge fighters were killed and 41 injured. 1 Mayi-Mayi Mutetezi was killed and 2 were injured. At least 800 cows were stolen by the Mayi-Mayi assailants, who drove the Banyamulenge out of these villages. Fatalities coded across 4 events.

column7: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kibukila); Babembe Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Bafuliru Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Mayi Mayi Militia (Android); Mayi Mayi Militia (Makanika); Banyamulenge Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 9 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi Mutetezi militiamen led by Kibukila (Babembe and Bafuliru ethnic groups) clashed with Banyamulenge ethnic militias led by Makanika (Ngumino, Twiganeho and Android) in Kamombo village (Fizi, Sud-Kivu), following simultaneous attacks at various villages by the Mutetezi. Overall, 18 Banyamulenge fighters were killed and 41 injured. 1 Mayi-Mayi Mutetezi was killed and 2 were injured. At least 800 cows were stolen by the Mayi-Mayi assailants, who drove the Banyamulenge out of the village. Fatalities coded across 5 events.

column7: Mayi Mayi Militia (Kibukila); Babembe Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Bafuliru Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Mayi Mayi Militia (Android); Mayi Mayi Militia (Makanika); Banyamulenge Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 9 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi Mutetezi militiamen led by Kibukila (Babembe and Bafuliru ethnic groups) clashed with Banyamulenge ethnic militias led by Makanika (Ngumino, Twiganeho and Android) in Kawera village, near Minembwe (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu), following simultaneous attacks at various villages by the Mutetezi. Overall, 18 Banyamulenge fighters were killed and 41 injured. 1 Mayi-Mayi Mutetezi was killed and 2 were injured. At least 800 cows were stolen by the Mayi-Mayi assailants, who drove the Banyamulenge out of the village. Fatalities coded across 5 events.
On 9 September 2020, a group of local people beat to death a man accused of theft in Gumu village, near the mining town of Durba (Watsa, Haut-Uele). [size=no report]

column6: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
column17: On 9 September 2020, FDLR-FOCA militamen killed 2 women and 1 man in Nakabumbi village (Nyiragongo, Nord-Kivu). No more details were reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Women (Democratic Republic of Congo); Refugees/IDPs (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Around 9 September 2020 (week of), at least 4 women were raped by unidentified armed militiamen in Walu (Irumu, Ituri). The victims, internally displaced, were raped when they were working in the fields. The area is frequented by some militias.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 9 September 2020, an unidentified armed group, comprised of 12 combatants, raped 1 woman when she was returning from her field near Samungu village (Ango, Bas-Uele).

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 9 September 2020, unidentified militiamen clashed with the FARDC in Numbi village (Kalehe, Sud-Kivu), after these rebels looted goods from the local population. 1 woman was shot and injured in the clash.

On 9 September 2020, 290 Burundian refugees demonstrated for the second straight day at the border, near Kamanyola town (Walungu, Sud-Kivu), to demand their repatriation to Burundi despite the closure of the border imposed since the coronavirus pandemic. They denounced the bad conditions in which they live in the transit camps. Some demonstrators tried to cross the border between by force. [size=290]

column6: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column17: On 9 September 2020, FPIC armed men shot and injured 5 children during looting in Masiya village, near Marabo village (Irumu, Ituri). The rebels stole 60 cows and killed 5 of them on the spot. The FARDC chased the assailants into the bush and managed to recover some cows.

On 9 September 2020, ADF militiamen shot dead 3 civilians travelling on a motorbike on the road Mbau-Kamango, near Mamunjoma village (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The FARDC arrived when the attackers had already left.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 9 September 2020, a local militia called the Assailants of Gutsi signed a ceasefire agreement with the authorities in Gutsi village, within Walendu-Djatsi chieftaincy (Djugu, Ituri). They agreed to lay off their arms after peace negotiations with the delegation of ex-warlords sent by the president Tshisekedi in this province.
On 9 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi Twirwaneho militiamen abducted 5 farmers in Kitarama (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu).

On 9 September 2020, South Sudanese Military Forces burned down several houses during an incursion in Karagba village, within Kakwa chieftaincy (Aru, Ituri). Reportedly, the South Sudanese forces crossed the border to chase South Sudanese NAS rebels. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 9 September 2020, the FARDC clashed for a few minutes with South Sudanese Military Forces in Kakwa chieftaincy, near Rumu (Aru, Ituri), following an incursion by the South Sudanese in which they torched houses. 3 South Sudanese solders were arrested by the FARDC. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 9 September 2020, South Sudanese Military Forces burned down several houses during an incursion in Yingi village, within Kaliko-Omi chieftaincy (Aru, Ituri). Reportedly, the South Sudanese forces crossed the border to chase South Sudanese NAS rebels. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 10 September 2020, a group of people who worked more than 15 years for a mining company demonstrated for the forth straight day in Mbuji Mayi city (Mbuji Mayi, Kasai-Oriental) to show their outrage for the hiring of new workers by this company, after they were fired alleging bankruptcy. The ex-workers harassed the new workers by breaking into the hospital where medical exams were being taken. [size=no report]

column6: Baniari Tchabi Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column16: AFP; Radio Okapi; Actualite; Bunia Actualite; AP; Reuters
column17: On 10 September 2020, local people armed with machetes killed between 22 and 35 civilians, including children and women, during another attack in Belu village (Irumu, Ituri). Many other civilians went missing. The victims were all Hutus. The attack was linked to intercommunal conflicts but the facts were not clear. A brigade from MONUSCO was sent to the scene along with FARDC troops to investigate the attack.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 10 September 2020, a group of local people set barricades on the main road Goma-Kiwanja in Kibumba (Nyiragongo, Nord-Kivu). They cut the road in response to the killing of a man and a woman the previous night by alleged robbers. The police and the FARDC intervened by firing into the air and teargas to disperse the crowd. [size=no report]

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 10 September 2020, ADF militia combatants clashed with the FARDC in Mbau (Beni, Nord-Kivu), after simultaneous offensives by theses rebels against 4 FARDC positions surrounding this village. The FARDC managed to drive the assailants out of the village. The local residents fled towards Oicha town. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 10 September 2020, CODECO militiamen robbed and abducted 8 miners in Mayolo village, a mining site within Baniari de Kilo chieftaincy (Djugu, Ituri). 7 of the victims managed to escape after a few hours.
On 10 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi Rushaba armed men killed 1 man and 1 woman (spouse) in Uvira town (Uvira, Sud-Kivu). No more information was disclosed.

column6: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 10 September 2020, Ngumino milita combatants abducted 2 men near Kakenge village (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu).

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 10 September 2020, unidentified armed people shot and killed 1 police officer in Muderi village, 4 Km form Rubaya (Masisi, Nord-Kivu), during an attack against a police station. 3 suspects (all women) were arrested by the state forces. This mining area is the scenario of long-standing mining and ethnic-based conflicts.

column6: FDBC: Force for the Defense of the Balkanization of Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 10 September 2020, a local militia called Force for the Defense of the Balkanization of Congo (FDBC) signed a ceasefire agreement with the authorities in Lipri village, within Walendu-Djatsi chieftaincy (Djugu, Ituri). They agreed to lay off their arms after peace negotiations with the delegation of ex-warlords sent by the president Tshisekedi in this province.

column6: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column17: Around 10 September 2020 (as reported), the MONUSCO established a UN military base in Mutwanga (Beni, Nord-Kivu), 8 years after it was dismantled. This deployment seeks to mitigate attacks by the ADF armed group in the area and protect local civilians.

column6: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: On 10 September 2020, FRPI (Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri) armed men ambushed and looted 60 students who were traveling near Boga (Irumu, Ituri). The assailants looted phones and other goods form the students, who were traveling home after the final exams.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 10 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with ADF militia rebels near Belu village (Irumu, Ituri). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column7: Bena Nshimba Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Bena Kapuya Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Bena Muembia Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 11 September 2020, local chiefs from Bena Nshimba village signed a peace agreement with chiefs from Bena Kapuya and Bena Muembia villages, in Katanda territory (Kasai-Oriental), with the mediation of the provincial authorities. These communities engaged in deadly clashes in early September 2020 triggered by land conflicts.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Women (Democratic Republic of Congo); Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 11 September 2020, a group of 14 men armed with edged weapons raped at least 2 nurses after breaking into a maternity hospital in the Kisenso district of Kinshasa (Kinshasa, Kinshasa). They looted the hospital and undressed and robbed several patients.

On 11 September 2020, a group of local people demonstrated in the border village of Nobili (Beni, Nord-Kivu) against the arrival of 30 Congolese refugees expelled by the Ugandan authorities. They were opposed to hosting the refugees amidst rumors that they could be troublesome people. [size=no report]

On 11 September 2020, a group of local people killed 1 man and severely injured another with machetes in Mulunda village, in Kongolo territory (Tanganyika). The victims were 2 thieves who had been captured by the locals after setting a house on fire during a robbery. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 11 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with CODECO militiamen in Mandro (Djugu, Ituri), after these rebels had robbed several cows from local pastoralists. The FARDC managed to recovered most of the cows. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 11 September 2020, a group of local people broke into the property of a local palm oil company and looted several goods in Yandjali village (Isangi, Tshopo). They carried out the looting in reaction to a land conflict that had prompted the destruction of homes located under this company's property. [size=no report]
On 11 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi Kifuafua Mbaenda armed men raped 11 women and wounded 5 men during an attack in Gbado village (Walikale, Nord-Kivu). They also set fire to houses and stole goods.

column7: Women (Democratic Republic of Congo); Collective of Women from Kasai-Central
column17: On 11 September 2020, women from several organizations under the Collective of Women from Kasai-Central marched in Kananga (Kananga, Kasai-Central) against gender and sexual violence and against the impunity of the perpetrators. They handed over memorandums to the authorities and the UN, who they asked for more involvement. [size=no report]

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 11 September 2020, a group of Mayi-Mayi militiamen led by Hercule clashed with the FARDC in Ekakyo mining site, near Misisi locality (Fizi, Sud-Kivu), after an attack by these rebels. The assailants, who had looted gold and other goods from the local miners, killed 1 FARDC commander and injured 3 other soldiers. The FARDC finally managed to drive the rebels out.

column7: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
column17: On 11 September 2020, a group of UDPS party members marched in Kananga (Kananga, Kasai-Central) against the nomination of provincial leaders by the deputy president of this party, Jean Marc Kabund. They set up barricades in streets with burning tires. The demonstration opposed another march in support to Marc Kabund. [size=no report]

column6: Fulani Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 11 September 2020, 2 armed Fulani men raped a woman who they just had abducted in Sonisape village, 12 km southwest of Banda locality (Ango, Bas-Uele), after storming this village by firing shots into the air.

column7: Vigilante Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Taxi Drivers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 11 September 2020, a mob of motorbike taxi drivers killed 1 civilian man (stoned to death) who was driving a car in Mudzipela locality (Irumu, Ituri). They killed the driver because he had fatally hit another taxi driver and had run away during a car accident. [size=no report]

On 12 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi FPP Kabido rebels wounded 3 men during an attack in Kisone village (Walikale, Nord-Kivu). They also forced 7 men to carry the goods they had looted and set fire to 5 houses.

column9: Women (Democratic Republic of Congo); Pastoralists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 12 September 2020, armed combatants from the National Lumumbist Resistance (RNL) raped 2 women during an incursion in the village of Isigi, near Manguredjpa (Lubero, Nord-Kivu). They also abducted 1 businessman who resisted the attack and looted farm animals, cows and other goods.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column16: Actualite; Kivu Security Tracker; Radio Okapi; La Prunelle
column17: On 12 September 2020, the police shot and killed 4 civilians (all artisanal miners), including at least 1 woman, and injured at least 5 others during an attack in one of the mining sites of Rubaya town (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). The attack occurred during an attempt to remove the miners from the mining site. The incident is also associated with mining conflicts confronting the company that runs the mines and the cooperative of artisanal miners.

column7: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
column17: On 12 September 2020, a group of UDPS party members marched in Kananga (Kananga, Kasai-Central) against the nomination of provincial leaders by the deputy president of this party, Jean Marc Kabund. [size=no report]
On 13 September 2020, ADF militiamen shot and killed 1 man in Maleki village (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The victim was ambushed by the rebels on the main road.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 13 September 2020, the FARDC chased and clashed with Mayi-Mayi Buhirwa men near Kisozi Kabumenge village (Uvira, Sud-Kivu), when these rebels were robbing a vehicle. The FARDC killed 2 rebels.

column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 13 September 2020, a mob of local people captured and killed 1 man (burned to death) in Boma (Boma, Kongo-Central). The victim was part of a group of assailants armed with machetes that had attacked and seriously injured a catholic priest during a robbery. [size=no report]
On 13 September 2020, Raia Mutomboki Ngandu militamen forced 6 local men to carry the loot after robbing cattle and goods in Lwigi village (Shabunda, Sud-Kivu).

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Women (Democratic Republic of Congo); Refugees/IDPs (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 13 September 2020, 1 woman was raped by 5 unidentified armed militiamen in Walu (Irumu, Ituri). The victim, internally displaced, was raped when she was working in the fields. The area is frequented by some militias.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 13 September 2020, unidentified armed men raped and then killed a 23-year-old woman in Kikarara village, 1 Km from Rugetsi locality (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 13 September 2020, CODECO militia combatants robbed some travelers during an ambush on the main road in Kotoni village (Djugu, Ituri).

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 13 September 2020, CODECO militia combatants looted 70 cows from local pastoralists in Kikoga village, 8 Km from Kasenyi (Irumu, Ituri). The FARDC chased the assailants and recovered some of the cows without clashes.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 13 September 2020, CODECO militia combatants occupied the village of Tckeki 3, within Baboa-Bakoe chieftaincy and near Miala (Irumu, Ituri). They blocked the road and intimidated the local population by firing gunshot in the air, forcing many locals to flee the area. The FARDC was not present.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 13 September 2020, CODECO militia combatants looted around 100 cows from local pastoralists in Mbetsi village, near Dele (Irumu, Ituri). The FARDC chased the assailants and recovered some of the cows without clashes.

column6: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 13 September 2020, suspected FPIC militia combatants clashed with the FARDC in Bambunya, near Bunia town (Irumu, Ituri), after they had torched around 10 homes during an incursion in this village. The FARDC drove the assailants out of this village. The local population fled the area. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column9: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column16: Radio Okapi; Actualite; BBC News; La Prunelle; Kivu Security Tracker
column17: On 13 September 2020, a group of local civilians from the Veranda Mutsanga pressure group who had organized clashed with the police and FARDC in Oicha (Beni, Nord-Kivu). 2 civilians (1 man and 1 woman) shot and killed and 6 shot and injured by the state forces. Reportedly, the fight started after the Veranda youth tried to confiscate firearms from law enforcement forces. The authorities opened an investigation to clarify the facts. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 13 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with unidentified armed rebels in Ngoyi village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu), during an offensive by the FARDC which resulted in 2 rebels killed.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 14 September 2020, unidentified armed men raped an 11-year-old girl after breaking into the victim's house in Kananga (Kananga, Kasai-Central).

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 14 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with NDC-R (Guidon faction) in Kailenge and Kaseke villages, both 3 Km from Pinga locality (Walikale, Nord-Kivu), following an offensive by the FARDC. 1 girl was shot and injured during the crossfire. The FARDC drove the rebels out of the area. The local population fled the area.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 14 September 2020, a group of local residents marched and barricaded some streets by setting tires on fire in the city of Kalemie (Kalemie, Tanganyika), against the provincial governor's decision to demolish an urban area of the city. [size=no report]

On 14 September 2020, a group of workers from private businesses marched in Gemena town (Gemena, Sud-Ubangi) to demand that authorities guarantee the SMIG (Minimum guaranteed inter-professional wage) for private employees. [size=no report]

On 14 September 2020, Raia Mutomboki-Bipompa armed men wounded 2 men during an incursion in Bigizi village, 1 Km from Cifunzi locality (Kalehe, Sud-Kivu). They also forced 2 men and 1 boy to carry the goods they had looted from the population.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 14 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with unidentified armed men in Mibaraka village, 4 Km from Ntoto village (Walikale, Nord-Kivu), following an offensive by the FARDC. 1 civilian man was killed and 1 armed man was captured by the FARDC.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 14 September 2020, members and supporters of Lucha civil society movement demonstrated in Beni (Beni, Nord-Kivu) against the killings of civilians by armed groups and the inaction of the authorities. They set up barricades with stones in several streets and called for a total halt of activities. Some demonstrators confronted the police, who arrested 31 people (11 of them with charges). During the confrontation, some policemen beat and robbed 1 man. [size=at least 31]

column6: CMC: Coalition of Movements of Change of the Congo
column17: Around 14 September 2020 (as reported), a new armed group called Coalition of Movements of Change of the Congo (CMC) was created and its base established 3 Km from Kiwanja city (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). This rebel group consists of the Nyatura, Mai Mai and some FDLR rebel fighters. They were said to be imposing a 5 USD tax on farmers.

column9: Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); WVI: World Vision International; Christian Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 14 September 2020, suspected Mayi Mayi militiamen from an unidentified faction shot dead 1 man (aid worker) and injured another during an ambush near Loufu (Lubero, Nord-Kivu). The assailants opened fire against a humanitarian convoy made of 4 vehicles belonging to the Christian INGO World Vision. 2 other aid workers were abducted and released hours later thanks to rapid community intervention.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 14 September 2020, unidentified armed militiamen kidnapped the director of a school in Rubare (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu) after breaking in his house. The perpetrators were believed to be from an organized armed group of the area.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 14 September 2020, unidentified armed men clashed with Mayi-Mayi Kifuafua (Delphin Mbaenda) armed men in Kaunchu village (Walikale, Nord-Kivu), following an attack by the first men. 3 attackers and 2 Mayi-Mayi Kifuafua fighters were wounded in the clash.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 14 September 2020, the police looted several goods from the local population in Yandjali village (Isangi, Tshopo). The policemen were deployed to protect the property of 1 local oil palm company that had been attacked by a group of locals following a land conflict. Many women and children fled towards the forest fearing the police. [size=no report]

column7: Vigilante Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); VM: Veranda Mutsanga
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column9: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column16: Radio Okapi; Twitter; Actualite; BBC News; La Prunelle
column17: On 14 September 2020, a mob of local people lynched 1 FARDC soldier, seized his gun and threw his body into a pit latrine in Oicha (Beni, Nord-Kivu) in reaction to the killing of 2 civilians from the Veranda Mutsanga pressure group the previous night by the FARDC. The police fired teargas to disperse the crowd, who had set barricades in several streets and on the main road. 29 people were arrested. [size=at least 29]

On 14 September 2020, NDC-R armed men of the Bwira faction clashed with NDC-R armed men led by Guidon in Pinga (Walikale, Nord-Kivu). 2 fighters were killed from the Guidon faction and 4 from the Bwira faction. 4 others from Guidon's faction were shot and injured. Some locals sought refuge in the local hospital.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 15 September 2020, members of Lucha civil society movement and other locals demonstrated for the second straight day in Beni (Beni, Nord-Kivu) against the killings of civilians by armed groups and the inaction of the authorities. The police dispersed the crowd using teargas before the demonstrators could set up barricades. The march had been banned by the mayor. [size=no report]

column6: CMC: Coalition of Movements of Change of the Congo
column17: On 15 September 2020, suspected armed men from the newly formed Coalition of Movements of Change of the Congo (CMC) shot and killed 4 civilians from the same family in Kiwanja town (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). The victims, who were hit by multiple bullets, were 2 women, 1 child and 1 baby and were all executed in their home. 2 other people were shot and injured.

On 15 September 2020, the workers of the public office in charge of transports gathered in front of their office in Kinshasa (Kinshasa, Kinshasa) against the arrest of their manager by the authorities. They claimed that the boss was victim of baseless accusations and announced a strike action. [size=no report]

On 15 September 2020, around 100 returnees to DRC from Angola marched and gathered in front of the UNHCR headquarters in Kananga (Kananga, Kasai-Central), denouncing that the UN agency had not give them all the money and kits of the reintegration process. [size=around 100]

On 15 September 2020, Raia Muomboki Mungoro wounded 3 civilian men and kidnapped 2 others during an incursion in Kashewe village (Kalehe, Sud-Kivu). They also stole livestock, food and other goods. They later demanded a ransom of 500 USD for the release of the victims.

On 15 September 2020, 14 Raia Mutomboki Shabani forced 2 men to carry the goods they had looted near Bubare village (Kalehe, Sud-Kivu). The assailants had robbed money and goods from a truck following an ambush.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: Around 15 September 2020 (as reported), suspected combatants of the National Lumumbist Resistance (RNL) clashed with the FARDC in Kalunguta village (Beni, Nord-Kivu), during an attack by these rebels against an FARDC camp. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 15 September 2020, CODECO militia combatants clashed with the FARDC in Kikoga village, 8 Km from Kasenyi (Irumu, Ituri), following an attack by these rebels. 5 militia combatants and 1 FARDC soldier died in the clash and at least 1 soldier was wounded. Initially, the assailants had stolen 233 cows but after the clash the FARDC managed to recover 58 of them.

column6: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column17: On 15 September 2020, a group of FPIC armed men abducted some men who were fixing the piping in Kolomani village, near Soleniama (Irumu, Ituri). During the incursion the assailants looted and torched some homes and sabotaged the village's piping, leaving various villages and even the city of Bunia with no water. The abducted workers were released a few hours later.

column6: Fulani Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 15 September 2020, 3 Fulani men armed with weapons and machetes looted 3 people hunting at 18 km northeast of Mugalie village (Ango, Bas-Uele).

column7: MSE: The Movement of the Unemployed; Labour Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 15 September 2020, a group of people represented by the MSE civil society movement (The Movement of the Unemployed) marched in the center of Kinshasa (Kinshasa, Kinshasa) to denounce the high unemployment and the lack of opportunities for the Congolese people within the job market, regardless of education level. [size=no report]

On 15 September 2020, a group of people from the Voice of the People civil society movement demonstrated in Lubumbashi (Lubumbashi, Haut-Katanga) to denounce rising insecurity in the city. They blamed the mayor's incompetence and asked for his resignation. [size=no report]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 15 September 2020, unidentified armed men raped and then killed a 13-year-old girl who they had abducted in Masisi locality (Masisi, Nord-Kivu).

column7: Batwa Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column9: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column17: Around 16 September 2020 (week of), around 50 Batwa combatants from the Hapa na pale militia surrendered and handed over their arms to the FARDC and MONUSCO in Zongwe (Moba, Tanganyika).
On 16 September 2020, ADF armed men shot and killed 1 man traveling on his motorbike on the road Mbau-Kamango, near Mamunjoma village (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
column17: Around 16 September 2020 (week of), Military Forces of Uganda patrolling the Lake Edward beat and injured 3 Congolese fishermen in this Lake, near Nyakakoma (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). The soldiers, who accused the men of fishing in Ugandan waters, seized their pirogues and material before releasing them.

column7: Hutu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Refugees/IDPs (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Around 16 September 2020 (from 9 - 23 September), around the 80 per cent of the population of Banyali Tshabi chieftaincy arrived in Tshabi locality (Irumu, Ituri) fleeing inter-ethnic tensions between the residents of the Banyabwisha community (Hutus). The Bwisha (Hutus from Rutshuru area) accused the Nyali (Hutus) of perpetrating killings occurred in early September.

On 16 September 2020, dozens of members and supporters of Lucha civil society movement marched in Beni (Beni, Nord-Kivu) against the killings of civilians by armed groups. This time they went to the city hall where they signed individual engagements that would allowed civilians to collaborate with the FARDC in its fight against the ADF armed group. [size=dozens]

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 16 September 2020, Ugandan soldiers abducted 1 Congolese policeman in the border village of Uriwo, within War-Palara chieftaincy and near Jakanja locality (Mahagi, Ituri). The motive behind the incident was not reported.

column7: CMC-FNLD: Collective Movement for Change-Front for National Liberation and Democracy
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 16 September 2020, Nyatura Domi (under the CMC alliance) clashed with the FARDC in Gashavu village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu), after an attack by the Nyatura group. Overall, 2 FARDC soldiers were killed and 5 were wounded. 1 Nyatura fighter was also killed and a civilian woman was wounded. 22 houses were burned down.

column7: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo; RNL: National Lumumbist Resistance
column17: Around 16 September 2020 (week of), armed men from the Congo Ebebi Movement, UPLC and RNL militias forced local people to work for them in Mambume village, within Bapere chieftaincy (Lubero, Nord-Kivu). They also forced people to pay taxes and looted cows from them.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 17 September 2020, a group of local people blocked the main road in Uvira town (Uvira, Sud-Kivu) to express their outrage for the killing of a civilian man by unknown armed men the same day. The police intervened and dispersed the demonstrators. [size=no report]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Women (Democratic Republic of Congo); Cibanda Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 17 September 2020, unidentified armed men shot and killed 1 woman and beat up her husband after breaking in their home in Cibanda locality (Walungu, Sud-Kivu). The husband, who was severely injured, was the chief of this locality.

Around 17 September 2020 (as reported), a group of Mayi-Mayi called Congo Ebebi Movement (CEB), a militia loyal to Mayi-Mayi Dragon, looted several shops and homes and intimidated the local population in Liboyo village, near Manguredjpa (Lubero, Nord-Kivu).

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 17 September 2020, policemen based at a road control beat up 1 traveler in Benze (Nyunzu, Tanganyika). The man was whipped by the policemen because he refused to pay road taxes.

On 17 September 2020, members of the Lucha civil society movement marched in Butembo city (Beni, Nord-Kivu) against the killings of civilians by armed groups in Nord-Kivu and Ituri and the inaction by the state authorities and the FARDC. [size=no report]

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 17 September 2020, around 300 returnees from Angola demonstrated in Kananga (Kananga, Kasai-Central). They went to the UNHCR headquarters for a second day to denounce a lack of support for the reintegration process. After some negotiations, the police intervened to disperse the crowd using teargas and the demonstrators confronted them by throwing stones. 1 woman and 4 policemen were slightly injured. 2 people were arrested and then released. [size=around 300]

column6: Kalala Mukwa Ndaba Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Tshinyambu Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Around 17 September 2020 (as reported), local people from Kalala Mukwa Ndaba village clashed with locals from the neighboring Tshinyambu village in both villages, within Luiza territory (Kasai-Central). Overall, 5 women were raped, 5 people were seriously injured and 10 homes were burned down.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: Around 17 September 2020 (as reported), FARDC soldiers forced travelers to pay illegal taxes in a new roadblock set up by the military in Eringeti locality (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

On 17 September 2020, members and supporters of Lucha civil society movement marched in Beni (Beni, Nord-Kivu) against the killings of civilians by armed groups and also to demand the release of their fellow members arrested and charged by the authorities during another demonstration early that week. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column9: Catholic Christian Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 17 September 2020, unidentified armed men wearing FARDC military uniforms shot and injured a Catholic priest in Beni (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The assailants took the victim's motorbike and fled the area without stealing anything else from him.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Okapi National Park
column17: On 17 September 2020, suspected Mayi-Mayi Simba, led by Manu, shot and killed 2 rangers of the Okapi Wildlife Reserve and injured 5 others in Adusa (Mambasa, Ituri), after an ambush by these rebels. The motive and circumstances of the attack were unclear.
On 18 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi rebels linked to the NDC-R armed group and led by a man called Naboti tortured and seriously injured 1 civilian man in Kirima village (Lubero, Nord-Kivu).

column6: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 18 September 2020, Burundian Red Tabara militiamen clashed with unidentified armed men during an incursion in Ngendo village (Uvira, Sud-Kivu). The latter, whose men raped 2 women and looted the population, were finally driven out of the village.

column6: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 18 September 2020, Twiganeho armed men killed 1 boy in his field in Canzovu village (Uvira, Sud-Kivu). The motive of the attack was not reported.

column8: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 18 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi Ebu Ela (under the command of Joshi) clashed with Ngumino militia combatants in Byalere village (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu), after the latter wanted to attack the population in this village. The Ebu Ela drove the Ngumino out of the village. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 18 September 2020, unidentified armed men killed 2 people in Kirambu village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). The attack was linked to other attacks targeting civilians by some of the local militias of the area.

column6: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column17: On 18 September 2020, FPIC militia combatants set some homes on fire during an incursion in Bambunya village, near Bunia town (Irumu, Ituri). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column9: Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Ngongo Communal Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 18 September 2020, FPIC militia combatants kidnapped 3 aid workers from Caritas and 1 customary chief who was with them in Ngongo village, near Bunia (Irumu, Ituri). The victims had gone to carry out repairs at a water plant sabotaged by the militia early that week. Many residents of different suburbs of Bunia town remained with no potable water.

column6: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: On 18 September 2020, suspected APCLS combatants armed with edged weapons killed 4 civilians, including 1 child, in Kishee village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). The victims were beheaded by the attackers in an area controlled by the FARDC.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 18 September 2020, ADF militia combatants clashed with the FARDC in Ntoma village, near Halungupa locality (Beni, Nord-Kivu), following an attack by these rebels. The latter shot and killed 2 soldiers and 3 civilians. The lifeless bodies were found by the FARDC days later. 3 other civilians went missing.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 18 September 2020, armed men from an unidentified militia killed 3 pastoralist men in Lukole village, within Osso Banyungu chieftaincy (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). The assailants, who beheaded the victims after shooting them, also slaughtered 1 cow on the spot and took its meat.

On 18 September 2020, a group of local civilians killed 4 Mayi-Mayi rebels (stoned to death) in Vingyo village (Lubero, Nord-Kivu). The rebels were local militiamen linked to the NDC-R armed group and led by a man called Naboti, who was also killed by the vigilantes. They were accused of continued violations against the local population, including a man who they tortured the same day. [size=no report]

column6: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column17: On 18 September 2020, the MONUSCO closed its main base in Kindu (Kindu, Maniema), as part of its progressive retreat operation from the less conflicted areas. This UN Mission handed over most of all their equipment and material to the provincial authorities.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 19 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with Raia Mutomboki Kabazimia armed men in Kantombi village (Shabunda, Sud-Kivu) and its neighboring Kegele village. The rebels had forced 6 men, 3 women, and 4 boys to carry the goods they had looted in these villages, including gold. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 19 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with unidentified militamen who had stolen 51 cows in Kagogo village (Uvira, Sud-Kivu). The FARDC recovered 45 of the cows. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 19 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with Raia Mutomboki Kabazimia armed men in Kegele village, near Kantombi (Shabunda, Sud-Kivu). The rebels had forced 6 men, 3 women, and 4 boys to carry the goods they had looted in these villages, including gold. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 19 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi Kashumba, a local defense militia, clashed with the FARDC near Kagogo village (Uvira, Sud-Kivu). These militiamen attacked the FARDC as the state forces had been looting cows in several villages around the area. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

Around 19 September 2020 (weekend of), Mayi-Mayi armed men from the Congo Ebebi Movement militia (under the command of a man called Dragon) abducted 1 civilian man in Njiapanda village, within Bapere chieftaincy (Lubero, Nord-Kivu). These rebels also stormed a local radio and threatened and intimidated its journalists. As a consequence, the radio broadcasting was interrupted for 2 days due to the threats.

Around 19 September 2020 (as reported), 1 militia called Republic of Kivu (led by a man called Soleil) and another led by a man called Shabani were reportedly newly created in the locality of Katana (Kabare, Sud-Kivu). They erected roadblocks and forced the local population to pay taxes. The political aims of both militias were not reported.

column6: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 19 September 2020, Twiganeho armed men abducted 1 man and his son in Kakenge village (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu).

On 20 September 2020, a group of local people beat to death 1 man and then burned his body in Bubale 1 village, within Buhavu chieftaincy (Kabare, Sud-Kivu). The victim was accused of stealing a goat. [size=no report]

column9: Street Traders (Democratic Republic of Congo); Farmers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 20 September 2020, NDC-R ex-combatants armed with machetes and batons looted a local market and crops in Kabaya (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). These men are part of the 500 ex-combatants held in a military base in Rumangabo waiting to join the demobilization process. Since they arrived there, they are accused of carrying out continued violations against local civilians.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column16: Radio Okapi; AFP; La Libre Afrique
column17: On 20 September 2020, ADF militia combatants clashed with the FARDC during an attack by these rebels in Kitoho (Beni, Nord-Kivu) and other nearby villages. Overall, the rebels killed 10 civilians (8 women and 2 men) and 1 FARDC soldier. 3 other people were injured. Also, around 15 people were abducted (5 lifeless bodies were found 6 days later), including women, and several houses were looted and burned down. They also robbed cattle and goats. 16 fatalities coded across 3 events.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column16: La Libre Afrique; Radio Okapi; AFP
column17: On 20 September 2020, ADF militia combatants clashed with the FARDC during an attack by these rebels in Mangboko (Beni, Nord-Kivu) and other nearby villages. Overall, the rebels killed 10 civilians (8 women and 2 men) and 1 FARDC soldier. 3 other civilians were injured. Also, around 15 people were abducted (5 lifeless bodies were found 6 days later), including women, and several houses were looted and burned down. They also robbed cattle and goats. 16 fatalities coded across 3 events.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column16: La Libre Afrique; AFP; Radio Okapi
column17: On 20 September 2020, ADF militia combatants clashed with the FARDC during an attack by these rebels in Mbau (Beni, Nord-Kivu) and other nearby villages. Overall, the rebels killed 10 civilians (8 women and 2 men) and 1 FARDC soldier. 3 other people were injured. Also, around 15 people were abducted (5 lifeless bodies were found days later), including women, and several houses were looted and burned down. They also robbed cattle and goats. 16 fatalities coded across 3 events.

column6: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 20 September 2020, 4 road carriers riding bicycles were abducted by Batwa militiamen in Mazembe village, near Mbulula (Kongolo, Tanganyika).

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 20 September 2020, the police clashed with unidentified armed men in Bunia (Irumu, Ituri). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: Around 20 September 2020 (as reported), police officers forced travelers to pay illegal road tolls in a roadblock in Bonkulu locality (Bagata, Kwilu).

On 21 September 2020, hundreds of members and supporters of Vital Kamerhe under the collective SVK (Support Vital Kamerhe) held a demonstration in Goma (Goma, Nord-Kivu). They demanded the release of this politician, sentenced to 20 years in jail for corruption, and the involvement of the president to guarantee his freedom. [size=hundreds]

On 21 September 2020, a group of local people beat to death a man in Bukavu (Bukavu, Sud-Kivu). The man, accused of being a rapist, was reportedly captured by the locals during a rape attempt. [size=no report]

On 21 September 2020, around 1,000 families arrived in Mangina village (Beni, Nord-Kivu) fleeing from ADF attacks in the area of Mbau, occurred the previous day. Some of them were hosted by local people.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 21 September 2020, CODECO militia rebels shot and killed 1 artisanal miner in a mining site in Baniari de Kilo chieftaincy (Djugu, Ituri).

On 21 September 2020, a group of lawyers marched in Gemena town (Gemena, Sud-Ubangi) against the lack of judges and magistrates in this province, which is triggering cases of mob justice. [size=no report]

column9: CW: Concern Worldwide; Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column16: Kivu Security Tracker; Actualite; La Prunelle
column17: On 21 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi Mbulu armed men abducted 3 aid workers from the INGO Concern Worldwide in Sange locality (Uvira, Sud-Kivu). The assailants ambushed 1 vehicle and robbed its 6 passengers before kidnapping 3 of them (2 agents and 1 driver). They demanded a ransom of 6,000 USD. The victims were released 2 days later after community intervention.

column6: Niangara Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Pastoralists (Democratic Republic of Congo); Fulani Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 21 September 2020, a communal local militia attacked Fulani pastoralists in their camp in Zande village, 4 km south of Niangara (Dungu, Haut-Uele). The assailants set the huts of the Fulani camp on fire and killed 5 cattle, forcing them to flee the area.

column9: Labour Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column16: Radio Okapi; Actualite; 7 Sur 7; Kivu Security Tracker
column17: On 21 September 2020, ADF militia combatants killed 5 civilians (3 men and 2 women) during an attack in Musuku village (Mambasa, ituri), near the border with Beni territory. They also abducted civilians (the lifeless bodies of another 5 were found days later in the area) and looted and set fire to 13 houses and shops, including a health center. The local population fled towards Oicha and Magina.

column9: Mbororo Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Pastoralists (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 21 September 2020, group of locals set fire to a camp of Mbororo people during an attack in Guselyo locality, near Manziga (Poko, Bas-Uele). The attack triggered confrontations which resulted in 1 injured among the local attackers. At least 5 cows from the Mbororo were killed and many tents and also crops were damaged. Attacks against Mbororo nomadic herders are frequent in this area. [size=no report]

On 21 September 2020, a group of young people held a demonstration in the mining town of Kamituga (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu) to demand support from the authorities to the victims of a mine collapse occurred on 11 September in which dozens of artisanal miners died. [size=no report]

column9: Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 22 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi Reunion armed men robbed a vehicle belonging to an NGO (African Doctors) near Kabumbe village (Fizi, Sud-Kivu).

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 22 September 2020, a group of local civilians set barricades with burning tires and marched in the mining Misisi locality (Fizi, Sud-Kivu). They demonstrated to show their outrage for the killing of a local man by bandits the previous night and the general increase of banditry in this area. The police fired bird-shots to disperse the demonstrators. [size=no report]

column7: UNC: Union for the Congolese Nation
column17: On 22 September 2020, around 10 supporters of the UNC party demonstrated in Goma (Goma, Nord-Kivu) to demand the release of their leader Vital Kamerhe, sentenced to 20 years in jail for corruption, and the involvement of the president to free him. They barricaded the road with rocks and tried to set tires on fire. However, some neighbors opposed the barricades and they finally left the area before the police intervened. [size=around 10]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 22 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with NDC-R militiamen (Guidon wing) in Kailenge village, 3 Km from Pinga town (Walikale, Nord-Kivu), following an operation by the state forces. 17 FARDC soldiers were reportedly killed in the clash. No information reported on deaths from NDC-R ranks. The FARDC finally drove the rebels out of the village.

On 22 September 2020, local residents of the Briqueville district marched in Lubumbashi city (Lubumbashi, Haut-Katanga) to denounce continued attacks by bandits, especially after deadly attacks in which some homes were torched. The demonstrators met the mayor and asked him to authorize residents to form self-defense militias of vigilantes. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
column17: On 22 September 2020, Military Forces of Uganda patrolling the Lake Edward beat up 24 Congolese fishermen after arresting them in this Lake near Kasika village, near Kyavinyonge (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The soldiers, who accused the men of fishing in Ugandan waters, seized their pirogues and material before releasing them.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column17: On 22 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with FPIC militia rebels in Babode and Beabo villages, both within Babelebe chieftaincy (Irumu, Ituri), following an operation by the FARDC. The clashed resulted in between 5 and 13 rebels killed and weapons and ammunition seized by the FARDC. The local population, who suffered lootings during the clashes, temporary fled the area.

column7: Filimbi Movement; LUCHA: Fight for Change
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 23 September 2020, members and supporters of Filimbi and Lucha civil society movements as well as other activists marched in Kinshasa (Kinshasa, Kinshasa) to demand the expulsion of the Rwandan ambassador for his comments in connection with the denial of massacres during the Second Congo War. The police intervened using teargas to disperse the demonstrators, triggering confrontations which led to several arrests. [size=no report]

On 23 September 2020, a group of local people barricaded with rocks the main road in Sange (Uvira, Sud-Kivu). They showed their disagreement for the decision to relocate to Bukavu town the trial of the FARDC officer accused of killing 15 civilians in Sange. [size=no report]

On 23 September 2020, The NDC-R (Bwira wing) clashed with the NDC-R (Guidon wing) in Rungoma village, 3 Km from Pinga (Walikale, Nord-Kivu), following an attack by the Bwira men. Overall, 3 NDC-R Bwira Wing fighters and 4 NDC-R Guidon Wing fighters were wounded.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 23 September 2020, CODECO militia rebels stole 18 goats and property belonging to civilians in Bahema Nord chieftaincy (Djugu, Ituri).

column6: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Women (Democratic Republic of Congo); Refugees/IDPs (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 23 September 2020, suspected Ngumino militiamen raped 3 women (internally displaced) in Cakira village (Fizi, Sud-Kivu). They were then shot and injured by the rapists.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Aid Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); MSF: Doctors Without Borders
column17: On 23 September 2020, unidentified armed men kidnapped 1 aid worker from MSF INGO following an ambush near Masisi town (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). The assailants demanded a ransom. The hostage was released hours later.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 23 September 2020, armed men wearing military uniforms shot and killed 1 man and injured 1 woman in Munigi (Nyiragongo, Nord-Kivu). The motive behind the attack was not reported.

On 23 September 2020, civil society actors marched in Uvira town (Uvira, Sud-Kivu) to denounce the cycle of violence by armed groups in the Mwenga, Fizi and Uvira territories. They called to support the state forces but asked them to be neutral and equally protect all the communities. [size=no report]

column6: Niangara Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Hema Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 23 September 2020, an armed communal group attacked a group of armed Hema pastoralists in their camp in Makilingo village, 16 Km from Niangara (Dungu, Haut-Uele). The attackers killed 9 cows in retaliation for damage caused to fields and water sources by the livestock. Finally, a Hema pastoralist pulled out a gun, prompting the attackers to flee. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) FDP People's Defense Forces
column9: CMC-FNLD: Collective Movement for Change-Front for National Liberation and Democracy
column17: On 23 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with Nyatura FDP militia combatants (under the CMC alliance) in Kivuma village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), following a military operation. 1 Nyatura FDP fighter was wounded. The FARDC stole money, food, livestock, and other goods from the population.

column6: Kuluna Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 24 September 2020, Kuluna communal bandits killed 1 man with machetes in Kinshasa (Kinshasa, Kinshasa). The man had resisted a robbery by these attackers.

column6: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 24 September 2020, Ngumino militiamen wounded 3 women and abducted 2 others in the fields in Kabara village (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu).

column16: Actualite; Twitter; AFP; Radio Okapi; BPF
column17: On 24 September 2020, ADF militiamen armed with firearms and machetes killed 16 civilians, including women and children, during an attack in the village of Kinyambahore (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The local survivors fled the area.

On 24 September 2020, workers from a petroleum company gathered in front of the company building in Boma (Boma, Kongo-Central) against the decision of the government to limit the oil production, which has temporarily left them unemployed. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: Around 24 September 2020 (as reported), the FARDC clashed with NDC-R militiamen in Nkasa village, near Bushimoo (Walikale, Nord-Kivu), following an operation by the state forces. The FARDC drove the rebels out of town. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: Around 24 September 2020 (as reported), the FARDC clashed with NDC-R militiamen in Pinga (Walikale, Nord-Kivu), following an operation by the state forces. The FARDC drove the rebels out of town. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: Around 24 September 2020 (as reported), the FARDC clashed with NDC-R militiamen (Guidon wing) in Kaseke village (Walikale, Nord-Kivu), following an operation by the state forces. The FARDC finally drove the rebels out of the village. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: Around 24 September 2020 (as reported), the FARDC clashed with NDC-R militiamen (Guidon wing) in Mutongo village (Walikale, Nord-Kivu), following an operation by the state forces. The FARDC finally drove the rebels out of the village. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: Around 24 September 2020 (as reported), the FARDC clashed with NDC-R militiamen in Bushimoo village (Walikale, Nord-Kivu), following an operation by the state forces. The FARDC drove the rebels out of the village. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column7: UNC: Union for the Congolese Nation
column17: On 25 September 2020, several members of the UNC party and other supporters of Vital Kamerhe marched in front of the Palace of Justice in Kinshasa (Kinshasa, Kinshasa) in support of this politician, sentenced to 20 years in jail for corruption and currently waiting for an appeal process. [size=several]

On 25 September 2020, a group of college students destroyed and set on fire some facilities of the University in Lubumbashi (Lubumbashi, Haut-Katanga). They did this in reaction to an incident in which one fellow student was injured by university security guards. [size=no report]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 25 September 2020, unidentified armed men shot and killed 1 pastoralist man in his fields in Mwaba (Uvira, Sud-Kivu). The area is frequented by ethnic militias.

column6: Bakata Katanga Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Prison Guards
column17: On 25 September 2020, a group of Bakata Katanga militiamen clashed with prison guards in the Kasapa prison in Lubumbashi (Lubumbashi, Haut-Katanga), during an assault to liberate prisoners. Some prisoners joined the clashes, resulting in 6 prisoners seriously injured and serious property damage, including some buildings set on fire. Reportedly, a group of prisoners broke into the women's module and raped around 100 women prisoners. The authorities eventually managed to frustrate the escape.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 25 September 2020, NDC-R militia fighters led by Muisa Guidon clashed for about 2 hours with the FARDC in the villages of Mukaka, Kailenge and Katanga, all near Pinga locality (Walikale, Nord-Kivu), following an attack by the NDC-R men. Reportedly, the FARDC drove the rebels out of these localities. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 25 September 2020, suspected Mayi-Mayi militiamen (Sheikh Assan) shot and killed 2 civilian men in Saramabila (Kabambare, Maniema).

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 25 September 2020, the NDC-R (Guidon wing) clashed with the FARDC in Rungoma village (Walikale, Nord-Kivu), following an ambush by these rebels. Overall, 6 FARDC soldiers were killed, 3 were wounded and 4 NDC-R fighters were killed.
On 26 September 2020, ADF militiamen killed 1 civilian during an attack in Kingbayi village, located 7 Km from Mbau town (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column8: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: On 26 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi militiamen led by Roger Magumu clashed with FDLR militamen (led by Katulebe) in Nyamitwitwi village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), after an offensive by the Mayi-Mayi. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 26 September 2020, CODECO militiamen clashed with the police in Mongbwalu town (Djugu, Ituri), during an attack against a police station. 1 policeman was shot and killed by the assailants, who managed to free several detained people.

On 26 September 2020, a group of young people marched in Kananga (Kananga, Kasai-Central) to ask for the return of the former provincial governor, dismissed by this regional parliament after a motion of no confidence. [size=no report]

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: Around 26 September 2020 (from 25 -26 September), 50 young combatants of the UPC armed group, including a commander called Likuta, surrendered to the FARDC in the village of Ntonto, within Wanianga chieftancy (Walikale, Nord-Kivu). They handed over 6 weapons.

On 26 September 2020, more than 100 workers from a petroleum company marched in Boma (Boma, Kongo-Central) against the decision of the government to limit the oil production and consumption, which has temporarily left them unemployed. [size=more than 100]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 26 September 2020, unidentified armed men abducted 1 pastoralist in Buramba (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). The assailants stole their cows. The abduction took place in an area where armed groups were clashing with each other.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column9: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 26 September 2020, around 200 Mayi-Mayi Bakata Katanga militiamen armed with firearms, machetes and arrows clashed with the FARDC and the police during an incursion by these rebels in the center of Lubumbashi city (Lubumbashi, Haut-Katanga). Overall, 16 Mayi-Mayi were killed and many others injured by the state forces, who also captured 13 rebels and repelled the rest of fighters. 2 policemen were killed (decapitated) and 1 FARDC shot and killed. Reportedly, these Katanga pro-independence rebels tried to seize strategic public buildings despite the state's immediate response, whose troops reestablished order a few hours later.

column16: 7 Sur 7; Radio Okapi; Twitter; La Prunelle; BBC News
column17: On 26 September 2020, ADF militiamen killed between 2 and 5 civilians during an attack in Sikwaila locality (Beni, Nord-Kivu). Other civilians were seriously injured and at least 15 disappeared, including 13 from the same family.
On 26 September 2020, a group of workers of a cement company marched in Kalemie town (Kalemie, Tanganyika) to demand their unpaid salaries. [size=no report]

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) FDP People's Defense Forces
column7: CMC-FNLD: Collective Movement for Change-Front for National Liberation and Democracy
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 26 September 2020, Nyatura FDP armed men (under the CMC alliance) clashed with unidentified armed men in Kigezi village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), following an attack by the Nyatura FDP. The latter drove these armed men out of the village. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: Around 26 September 2020 (weekend of), at least 40 children belonging to unidentified armed groups surrendered to the FARDC in Ntoto village (Walikale, Nord-Kivu).

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 26 September 2020, CODECO militia combatants shot and injured 2 civilians in Uzi village, near Tsoro (Djugu, Ituri). The MONUSCO intervened later on and evacuated the victims.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: On 27 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with the APCLS armed group in the village of Kalungu (Masisi, Nord-Kivu) and other nearby villages, following a military offensive. Overall, at least 1 FARDC soldier was killed and 2 others were seriously injured in these villages. The FARDC dislodged the APCLS rebels from this village. The local population fled towards safer areas. 1 fatality reported across 4 locations.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: On 27 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with the APCLS armed group in the village of Katuunda, near Kalungu (Masisi, Nord-Kivu), and other nearby villages, following a military offensive. Overall, at least 1 FARDC soldier was killed and 2 others were seriously injured in these villages. The FARDC dislodged the APCLS rebels from this village. The local population fled towards safer areas. 1 fatality reported across 4 locations.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 27 September 2020, CODECO militia combatants killed 5 civilians from the same family (3 men, 1 woman and a 2-year-old child) during an attack in Mapendano village, 5 Km from Mongbwalu town (Djugu, Ituri). They also looted some homes.

column8: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: On 27 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi militiamen led by Roger Magumu clashed with FDLR militiamen (led by Katulebe) for the second straight day in Nyamitwitwi village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). One 12-year-old child was shot dead and 2 other civilians including a boy were shot and injured during the crossfire.

column7: CMC-FNLD: Collective Movement for Change-Front for National Liberation and Democracy
column8: FDLR-Turarambiwe: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (Turarambiwe Faction)
column17: On 27 September 2020, Nyatura militiamen of the Domi faction (under the CMC) clashed with FDLR-Turarambiwe armed men (led by Mamba Baziyaka) in Rugari locality (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), within the Virunga National Park. Reportedly, the Nyatura accused the Turarambiwe men of collaboration with M23 rebels. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 27 September 2020, unidentified armed militiamen abducted 7 civilians (5 of them women) in Birumu village, near Kabaya (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). The victims were freed unharmed hours later thanks to the intervention of the community and the FARDC.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 27 September 2020, Mayi-Mayi Mazembe clashed with the FARDC in Kinyatsi village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), following an offensive by the Mazembe to free fighters arrested by the FARDC. Overall, 1 Mazembe fighter was killed and 1 was captured. 2 FARDC soldiers were wounded.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: On 27 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with the APCLS armed group in the village of Hembe (Masisi, Nord-Kivu) and other nearby villages, following a military offensive. Overall, at least 1 FARDC soldier was killed and 2 others were seriously injured in these villages. The FARDC dislodged the APCLS rebels from this village. The local population fled towards safer areas. 1 fatality reported across 4 locations.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: On 27 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with the APCLS armed group in the village of Mianja (Masisi, Nord-Kivu) and other nearby villages, following a military offensive. Overall, at least 1 FARDC soldier was killed and 2 others were seriously injured in these villages. The FARDC dislodged the APCLS rebels from this village. The local population fled the area towards safer areas. 1 fatality reported across 4 locations.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
