column17: On 27 September 2020, CODECO militia combatants robbed 1 motorcycle after ambushing 2 civilians in Lipri village, near Mwanga (Irumu, Ituri).

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 27 September 2020, CODECO militia combatants looted and set fire to homes during an incursion in Amema village, within Baniari de Kilo chieftaincy (Djugu, Ituri).

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 27 September 2020, CODECO militia combatants killed 1 pastoralist (beheaded) during an incursion in Djida village, within Bahema Sud chieftaincy (Irumu, Ituri). They looted several homes before going back into the forest.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 28 September 2020, CODECO militia combatants killed a woman and a 13-year-old girl during an incursion in Di village, within Walendu-Djatsi chieftaincy (Djugu, Ituri).

column6: CMC: Coalition of Movements of Change of the Congo
column17: On 28 September 2020, suspected militiamen from the CMC (Coalition of Movements of Change of the Congo) and the recently formed Mayi-Mayi Amka Jeshi (made of former youth from Kiwanja) killed 2 men and injured another in Kibende village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). Reportedly, they were killed after refusing paying taxes imposed by these rebels to access the fields.

column7: CMC-FNLD: Collective Movement for Change-Front for National Liberation and Democracy
column8: FDLR-Turarambiwe: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (Turarambiwe Faction)
column17: On 28 September 2020, Nyatura militiamen of the Domi faction (under the CMC) clashed for the second straight day with FDLR-Turarambiwe armed men (led by Mamba Baziyaka) in Rugari locality (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), within the Virunga National Park. Reportedly, the Nyatura accused the Turarambiwe men of collaboration with M23 rebels. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
column17: On 28 September 2020, Military Forces of Uganda patrolling the Lake Edward beat up and whipped 12 Congolese fishermen after arresting them in this Lake near Kagezi (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). The soldiers, who accused the men of fishing in Ugandan waters, seized their pirogues and material.

column7: Labour Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Miners (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 28 September 2020, a group of workers of a mining company gathered in front of the company's building in Kindu town (Kindu, Maniema) to demand their unpaid salaries of the last 9 months and their medical insurance. [size=no report]

column6: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column17: On 28 September 2020, 2 FPIC militia combatants killed 1 man with machetes in Tcheki 2 village (Irumu, Ituri).

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 28 September 2020, unidentified armed men killed an FARDC soldier and a man during an attack in a bar in Rubaya locality (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). They also wounded another man. This locality suffers continued attacks triggered by mining conflicts.

column9: Women (Democratic Republic of Congo); Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 28 September 2020, a group of local people stoned and injured a woman in Ntalangwa village (Idjwi, Sud-Kivu) after she had attempted to rape a 15-year-old boy. The police intervened and saved the woman from being killed. [size=no report]

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 28 September 2020, suspected Mayi-Mayi Sheikh Assan armed men (also called Malaika) shot and killed 1 FARDC element in Saramabila (Kabambare, Maniema). Reportedly, the attack was the response to an arrest of a Mayi-Mayi leader by the state forces.

column7: Labour Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Miners (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 28 September 2020, a group of workers of a mining company marched in Bukavu town (Bukavu, Sud-Kivu) to demand their unpaid salaries and their medical insurance. [size=no report]

On 28 September 2020, a group of local residents barricaded a road with rocks and other items in Bukavu (Bukavu, Sud-Kivu). They did this to show their outrage for the precarious state of a road in the center of this city. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: On 28 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with APCLS rebels in Mianja village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu), following an attack by the state forces. 1 FARDC soldier was shot dead.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 28 September 2020, FARDC soldiers killed a 14-year-old boy and wounded another civilian man in Loashi village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu).

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column17: On 28 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with the APCLS armed group for the second straight day in the village of Luhundi, 10 Km from Masisi town (Masisi, Nord-Kivu), following a military offensive. The FARDC drove the APCLS rebels out of this village. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 28 September 2020, FARDC soldiers killed 1 man in an area 30 Km from Basoko (Basoko, Tshopo). Reportedly, the man was killed as he refused to pay illegal taxes to the soldiers.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column9: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 29 September 2020, a group of local residents vandalized the police station and other public buildings in Basoko (Basoko, Tshopo). They looted and set ablaze these buildings as well as private residences of local authorities in reaction to the killing of a civilian man by the FARDC. The police, who tried without success to disperse the crowd by firing warning shots, fled towards the forest. No fatalities and/or injuries reported. [size=no report]

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 29 September 2020, CODECO militia combatants killed 2 civilians (both decapitated with machetes) during an incursion in Akeso village, near Bunzenzele (Djugu, Ituri). The assailants looted and destroyed homes.

column7: CMC-FNLD: Collective Movement for Change-Front for National Liberation and Democracy
column8: FDLR-Turarambiwe: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda (Turarambiwe Faction)
column17: On 29 September 2020, Nyatura militiamen of the Domi faction (under the CMC) clashed for the third straight day with FDLR-Turarambiwe armed men (led by Mamba Baziyaka) in Rugari locality (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), within the Virunga National Park. Reportedly, the Nyatura accused the Turarambiwe men of collaboration with M23 rebels. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 29 September 2020, unidentified armed men shot and killed 1 man (a teacher and director a local school) in Kausa village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). The area is frequented by various armed groups.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) FDP People's Defense Forces
column7: CMC-FNLD: Collective Movement for Change-Front for National Liberation and Democracy
column17: On 29 September 2020 , Nyatura FDP (under the CMC alliance) armed men kidnapped 1 man after robbing his vehicle near Luve village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). They demanded a ransom for the hostage's release.

column6: CMC: Coalition of Movements of Change of the Congo
column17: On 29 September 2020, militiamen from the CMC (Coalition of Movements of Change of the Congo) killed 1 man in Katoro village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). Reportedly, he was killed after opposing paying taxes imposed by these rebels to access the fields.
On 29 September 2020, a group of local people stoned to death 1 man in Uvira town (Uvira, Sud-Kivu). He was accused of theft after stealing 1 phone. [size=no report]

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 29 September 2020, a group of policemen set fire to 15 homes belonging to the local population in Inongo town (Inongo, Mai-Ndombe). They did it in reaction to the killing of a fellow policeman, whose death they attributed to locals.

column7: LUCHA: Fight for Change; Filimbi Movement
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 29 September 2020, a group of members and supporters of Lucha and Filmbi civil society movements marched in Bandundu town (Bandundu, Kwilu) against the government of this province, whom they accused of malpractice and tribalism. The police intervened and dispersed the group, enforcing the ban on this march under the pretext of the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
column17: On 30 September 2020, the FARDC clashed with FDLR militiamen in Biruma (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). At least 1 FDLR fighter was killed and another was captured by the army. The local population fled the area.

column6: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column16: La Libre Afrique; Radio Okapi; AFP
column17: On 30 September 2020, FRPI (Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri) armed men led by Mbadhu Adirodu clashed with the FARDC in the center of Geti village (Irumu, Ituri), following an attack by these rebels against the FARDC. 3 FARDC soldiers, 6 rebels and 2 civilians were killed and 6 rebels and 4 soldiers were seriously injured. The assailants looted and caused important property damage including the building of a local NGO. Reportedly, the attack was in reaction to alleged insults by a FARDC commander against the leader of this militia. This rebel movement signed a peace accord with the government and the UN in February this year.

On 30 September 2020, a group of members of Lucha marched in Oicha locality (Beni, Nord-Kivu) against the local authorities, who they accused of mismanagement regarding the security situation. They also deplored the recurrent attacks against civilians by the ADF armed group. [size=no report]

On 30 September 2020, around 100 women held a spontaneous march in Rutshuru town (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu) to denounce the increasing violence by armed groups in their fields in Kibende locality. They also asked the authorities to dismantle a camp for displaced people which they accused of hosting rebels. [size=around 100]

Around 30 September 2020 (from 28 September - 02 October), around 11,000 people displaced from Saramabila town (Kabambare, Maniema) towards Kindu and other safer towns. They fled from clashes between the FARDC and the Mayi-Mayi Malaika militia (Sheikh Assan).

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column9: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 30 September 2020, CODECO militiamen killed 1 man in Imani Mata village, near Kilo locality (Djugu, Ituri). The victim, a local government chief, was reportedly killed after trying to engage the perpetrators into peace talks.

column6: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: Around 30 September 2020 (week of), APCLS armed men clashed with the FARDC in Buhala village, near Hembe (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). The clash prompted a displacement of the population and significant property damage. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: Around 30 September 2020 (week of), APCLS armed men clashed with the FARDC in Kalungu village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). The clash prompted a displacement of the population and significant property damage. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: On 30 September 2020, FRPI (Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri) armed men led by Mbadhu Adirodu set fire to a DDR camp (Disarmament, Demobilization and Reintegration) in Kagaba village (Irumu, Ituri). The camp had been set up by MONUSCO to host the rebels of this armed group.

column6: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: Around 30 September 2020 (week of), APCLS armed men clashed with the FARDC in Hembe village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). The clash prompted a displacement of the population and significant property damage. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column7: Judges (Democratic Republic of Congo); Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 1 October 2020, thousands of people from the civil society, including women victims of sexual violence, judges, health workers and other citizens marched in Bukavu (Bukavu, Sud-Kivu) to ask for justice, reparations and support for the victims of the Congo wars. They made these demands on the 10th anniversary of the publication of the UN Mapping Report, which provides details on various crimes and recommends the creation of an International Criminal Tribunal for the DRC. [size=thousands]

column7: Women (Democratic Republic of Congo); LUCHA: Fight for Change; Filimbi Movement
column17: On 1 October 2020, hundreds of women from the civil society and NGOs, including women victims of sexual violence as well as other civil society organizations like Lucha and Filimbi marched in Goma (Goma, Nord-Kivu) to ask for justice, reparations and support for the victims of the Congo wars. They made these demands on the 10th anniversary of the publication of the UN Mapping Report, which provides details on various crimes committed in the east and recommends the creation of an International Criminal Tribunal for the DRC. [size=hundreds]

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 1 October 2020, members of Filimbi civil society movement and other citizens marched in Kisangani (Kisangani, Tshopo) to ask for justice, reparations and support for the victims of the Congo wars on the 10th anniversary of the publication of the UN Mapping Report. The police intervened to enforce the ban on this march and dispersed the crowd using batons, resulting in 2 activists seriously injured. The mayor alleged security reasons to justify the ban. [size=no report]

On 1 October 2020, militiamen from the National Lumumbist Resistance (RNL) clashed with the Mayi-Mayi Congo Ebebi armed men (led by Dragon) in Liboyo village, near Manguredjpa (Lubero, Nord-Kivu), following an attack by the RNL. 5 Mayi-Mayi Congo Ebebi fighters and 1 civilian were killed and several other people were injured, including a woman who was seriously injured. 8 Mayi-Mayi Ebebi were captured by the RNL men (3 of them were executed later on and the rest were minors who were released). The FARDC took control of the village later that day and the locals fled towards Manguredjpa.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 1 October 2020, Mayi-Mayi Malaika (led by Sheikh Assan) armed men clashed with the FARDC in Kaselebela village, 10 Km from Saramabila (Kabambare, Maniema), following an ambush by these Mayi-Mayi against a military vehicle on patrol. 2 FARDC soldiers were killed and 5 injured by these rebels. Reportedly, the attack was a response to recent arrests of rebels by the FARDC.

On 1 October 2020, hundreds of people from the civil society marched in Kamituga (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu) to ask for justice, reparations and support for the victims of the Congo wars. They made these demands on the 10th anniversary of the publication of the UN Mapping Report, which provides details on various crimes committed in the east and recommends the creation of an International Criminal Tribunal for the DRC. [size=hundreds]

On 1 October 2020, local people from the civil society (many of them wearing black clothes) marched in Kalingi (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu) to ask for justice, reparations and support for the victims of the Congo wars. They made these demands on the 10th anniversary of the publication of the UN Mapping Report, which provides details on various crimes committed in the east and recommends the creation of an International Criminal Tribunal for the DRC. [size=no report]

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 1 October 2020, a group of people marched and barricaded the main road with burning tires in Mazinzi village, near Nyangezi (Walungu, Sud-Kivu), to denounce the kidnapping of a fellow neighbor by unknown armed men early that week. The FARDC intervened and dispersed the group by firing live ammunition, resulting in 1 demonstrator shot and injured. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: ARC: Alliance of Congolese Resistance Forces
column17: On 1 October 2020, FARDC soldiers on patrol clashed with 2 Mayi-Mayi ARC (Alliance of Congolese Resistance Forces) in Nyamilima town (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), following an attack by the FARDC. The 2 Mayi-Mayi and 1 FARDC soldier were killed.

On 1 October 2020, health workers marched in Oicha (Beni, Nord-Kivu) to demand more safety for the health facilities in Beni territory, given the increase of armed group attacks. They handed over a memorandum to the authorities and announced a 2 day strike in various localities. [size=no report]

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-2019) Prison Guards
column17: On 1 October 2020, a group of prisoners confronted the prison guards by throwing them stones in the Central prison in Mbuji-Mayi town (Mbuji-Mayi, Kasai-Oriental). The uprising was in reaction to abuse by prison guards as they forced visitors to bribe them when they brought food to the inmates. The police controlled the situation and arrested 1 guard. [size=no report]

On 1 October 2020, a group of local people marched in Kenge (Kenge, Kwango) to denounce a massacre occurred in this town in 1997 during the first Congo War. They asked for justice, reparations and support for the victims on the 10th anniversary of the publication of the UN Mapping Report, which provides details on various crimes committed in the east and recommends the creation of an International Criminal Tribunal for the DRC. [size=no report]

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 2 October 2020, the police arrested 48 people in Biakato (Mambasa, Ituri). The arrested had first been captured and intimidated by the local population as they suspected they were collaborators of a militia.

On 2 October 2020, members of local civil society groups marched in Masisi Centre (Masisi, Nord-Kivu) to denounce the increasing violence by armed groups in the area, including killings, kidnappings and lootings. [size=no report]

On 2 October 2020, members of the family of a famous albino boxer who died recently marched in Kinshasa city (Kinshasa, Kinshasa) to demand more money from the government to cover his funeral. They complained that the 6,000 USD received from the authorities was not enough. [size=no report]
On 2 October 2020, ADF rebels killed 7 civilians with machetes, including 1 woman and 2 children, during an attack in Mamove village (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Kuluna Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 2 October 2020, the police arrested 812 presumed Kuluna militiamen in Kinshasa city (Kinshasa, Kinshasa) after various raids. The arrested were accused of the increase of kidnappings and other crimes in this city.

column6: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 3 October 2020, FPIC militiamen clashed with the FARDC in Kunda village, within Babelebe chieftaincy (Irumu, Ituri), following an attack by these rebels against a military post. The FARDC shot and killed 5 rebels and repelled the attack.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Women (Democratic Republic of Congo); Labour Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 3 October 2020, unidentified armed militiamen killed 1 woman in Kukicha village, near Baraka (Fizi, Sud-Kivu), following an ambush by these armed men against a group of local traders. They stole gold and other goods from the traders.
On 3 October 2020, a leader of Mayi-Mayi Mazembe militia, known as Eugide, stabbed and killed a resident during an incursion in Munoli village (Lubero, Nord-Kivu).

On 3 October 2020, members and supporters of the Veranda Mutsanga civil society group marched in Beni (Beni, Nord-Kivu) against repeated killings by armed groups. They demanded the reinforcement of the security and the resumption of the prosecution process against ADF rebels. [size=no report]

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 3 October 2020, Raia Mutomboki militiamen from the coalition Republic of Kivu clashed with FARDC elements in an area within the Kahuzi Biega park, near Kabushwa (Kabare, Sud-Kivu), following an attack by these rebels against a military post. A 10-year-old child was killed and 1 FARDC soldier was injured by the rebels.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 3 October 2020, a hundred members and supporters of the Veranda Mutsanga civil society group marched in Butembo (Lubero, Nord-Kivu) against the violence committed by the ADF armed group since 2014. The police intervened and dispersed the crowd using teargas after the demonstrators had chanted hostile songs against the state forces. [size=a hundred]

column7: Mayi Mayi Militia (Hapa na pale); Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
column9: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 4 October 2020, 43 Batwa combatants from the Fimbo faction (including children), which belongs to the Hapa na pale militia, surrendered to the MONUSCO and the FARDC in Nsela village (Kalemie, Tanganyika) and joined the DDR process. These rebels, including their commander called Mundusi, handed over 32 firearms.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 4 October 2020, CODECO militiamen shot and killed 4 civilians, including 2 women, during an attack in Liseyi village, near Kilo (Djugu, Ituri). The victims were killed in their homes.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 4 October 2020, CODECO militiamen killed 1 civilian man with machetes in Iga Barriere locality (Djugu, Ituri).

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 4 October 2020, unidentified armed men shot and killed 2 civilians in Matete village, near Pimbo (Djugu, Ituri). The victims were the driver and another passenger of a car that was ambushed by these unknown militiamen. The other 6 passengers of the car were unharmed.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 4 October 2020, CODECO militiamen killed 4 civilians including 2 children aged 9 and 10 and a woman (a teacher) in an ambush near Bule (Djugu, Ituri).

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 4 October 2020, the FARDC chased and clashed with Hapa na pale militiamen near Munena village (Nyunzu, Tanganyika), after these rebels had abducted 4 civilians during a raid. 2 of the abducted, who had stab injuries, were freed by the FARDC.
On 4 October 2020, Hapa na pale militiamen abducted 4 local civilians during an incursion in Munena village (Nyunzu, Tanganyika) in which they looted several homes.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 4 October 2020, unidentified armed men raped a woman who they had kidnapped in Rutshuru town (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). The rapists demanded a ransom of 10,000 USD for the release of the victim.

column6: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) FDP People's Defense Forces
column7: CMC: Coalition of Movements of Change of the Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 4 October 2020, Nyatura FDP militiamen (under the CMC alliance) clashed with 2 FARDC soldiers in Birambizo village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), following an attack by the Nyatura. The latter killed 1 FARDC soldier and recovered 2 AK47 weapons.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 4 October 2020, unidentified armed men abducted 1 woman and her baby in Murambi village, near Busanza (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). The area is frequented by FDLR and other militias.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 5 October 2020, militiamen from an unidentified armed group clashed with the FARDC in Tulungu village, near Kilembwe (Fizi, Sud-Kivu), after an ambush by these armed men against a truck carrying FARDC soldiers and civilians. 2 civilians and 1 soldier were killed by the assailants, who also abducted 4 other civilians and 1 solider.

On 5 October 2020, a group of people who had gathered in the airport of Goma (Goma, Nord-Kivu) chanted against the president Felix Tshisekedi during his 2 day visit in this city. They blamed him for the spread of separatist movements in the east of the country. [size=no report]

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 5 October 2020, a group of local men attacked 1 police officer following a dispute in Panzudu village, within the War-Palara chieftaincy (Mahagi, Ituri). The policeman fired his weapon to disperse the attackers and killed a 17-year-old boy. The mob, which destroyed the shop where the policeman was hiding, attacked the policemen because he had an extra-marital affair. [size=no report]

On 5 October 2020, suspected local armed Mayi-Mayi (unknown group) in collaboration with ADF rebels killed 10 civilians and injured at least another, including farmers, during an incursion in Mamove village (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The survivors fled the area.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 5 October 2020, a group of teachers demonstrated in Mbandaka city (Mbandaka, Equateur) to demand their unpaid salaries. The police intervened and dispersed the rally on the pretext of the security restrictions imposed due to the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 5 October 2020, police forces shot and killed 2 men (miners) in Kahurizi village, near the mining town of Rubaya (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). The incident took place during the violent eviction of artisanal miners from a mining site.

On 5 October 2020, a group of local people barricaded the main road for hours in Rugari village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). They showed their outrage for the killing of a 18-year-old local boy by 1 FARDC soldier. [size=no report]

column6: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 5 October 2020, APCLS armed men clashed with the FARDC in Kahira village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu), following an attack by these rebels. The attackers shot and killed 1 soldier and drove the FARDC out of the village. They also burned down the FARDC camp.
On 5 October 2020, Mayi-Mayi Mazembe armed men killed 1 civilian man in Kikuku village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). No more details were reported.

column7: UNC: Union for the Congolese Nation
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 5 October 2020, members and supporters of the UNC party marched and barricaded some roads with burning tires in Goma (Goma, Nord-Kivu). They demand the release of their leader Vital Kamerhe the day the president Felix Tshisekedi arrived in this city for a 2 days state visit. The police intervened and dispersed the demonstrators without further incidents. [size=no report]

column7: ECIDE: Engagement for Citizenship and Development
column17: On 5 October 2020, members of the ECIDE party demonstrated in Isiro town (Rungu, Haut-Uele) against the president of this provincial parliament. They accused the president and his allies of misrepresenting the interests of the citizens of this province and asked for his dismissal. [size=no report]

On 6 October 2020, Mayi-Mayi Biloze Bishambuke armed men killed 2 pastoralist men and stole around 100 cows during an incursion in Kawera village, 10 Km from Minembwe (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu). The assailants also looted and torched some homes, forcing the locals to flee.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Naval Forces
column9: Fishermen (Democratic Republic of Congo); Prisoners (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: Around 6 October 2020 (as reported), FARDC soldiers (Naval Forces) attacked 2 fishermen who they had arrested in the Lake Albert, near Tchomia (Djugu, Ituri). Reportedly, the soldiers pushed the 2 fishermen into the water because they had refused to pay them money. 1 of the fishermen drowned.

On 6 October 2020, Mayi-Mayi Militiamen of the Congo Ebebi Movement, led by Dragon, tried to stab a civilian man and then robbed him in Ndjiapanda village, near Nyabili (Lubero, Nord-Kivu). These rebels had recently occupied the school building of this village, where they set up their camp after being forced to leave their stronghold due to clashes with other Mayi-Mayi groups.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 6 October 2020, members of various civil society organizations marched in Kikwit town (Kikwit, Kwilu) against the continued sale of public land by the local authorities. The police intervened and dispersed the march without further incidents. [size=no report]

On 6 October 2020, armed men from Raia Mutomboki Kabazimiya and Donat groups clashed with the Raia Mutomboki Kizamoto in Kakoga village (Shabunda, Sud-Kivu), after an attack by the Kabazimiya/Donat. 2 Kizamoto rebels and 3 Kabazimiya and Donat were killed. Goods were also stolen from the local population.
On 6 October 2020, a group of students demonstrated in Isiro town (Rungu, Haut-Uele) to ask for support from the authorities to pay the tuition fees for their superior studies. [size=no report]

column6: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 6 October 2020, APCLS armed men clashed with the FARDC in Kalungu village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 6 October 2020, APCLS armed men clashed with the FARDC in Hembe village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu) following and attack by these rebels against an FARDC post. The assailants burned down the FARDC camp. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 6 October 2020, APCLS armed men clashed with the FARDC in Buhala, near Hembe village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

Around 7 October 2020 (week of), Mayi-Mayi Hapa na pale militiamen carried out lootings during an incursion in the village of Mahole (Kongolo, Tanganyika). The local population fled the village towards safer areas.

Around 7 October 2020 (week of), Mayi-Mayi Hapa na pale militiamen carried out lootings during an incursion in the village of Ponda (Kongolo, Tanganyika). The local population fled the village towards safer areas.

Around 7 October 2020 (week of), Mayi-Mayi Hapa na pale militiamen carried out lootings during incursions in the villages of Binga, Mulilo, Lubanza, Lwayo and Ugananyoka, all within Bena-Nyembo chieftaincy (Kongolo, Tanganyika). The local population fled the village towards safer areas.

Around 7 October 2020 (week of), Mayi-Mayi Hapa na pale militiamen carried out lootings during an incursion in the village of Kahuwa, near Ponda (Kongolo, Tanganyika). The local population fled the village towards safer areas.

column6: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
column17: On 7 October 2020, UPLC militiamen led by Josue clashed with a group of RNL armed men (led by a man called Mille Tours par seconde) in Galo village, within Bapere chieftaincy (Lubero, Nord-Kivu), following an attack by the UPLC. 2 RNL men and 1 civilian were killed. Other civilians were also shot and injured.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 7 October 2020, a group of around 30 CODECO militiamen armed with firearms and machetes and wearing white headbands on their foreheads killed 2 pastoralist men and abducted another during an attack in Fichama village (Djugu, Ituri). They stole around 100 cows from the pastoralists.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column7: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: Around 7 October 2020 (week of), FARDC and police joint patrols carried out at least 13 robberies against civilians in Mongbwalu town (Djugu, Ituri). They abused their power by robbing phones and other goods from various civilians.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Women (Democratic Republic of Congo); Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 7 October 2020, a group of unidentified men dressed in blue uniforms broke into various homes and raped at least four girls in the Luwowoshi suburb in Lubumbashi city (Lubumbashi, Haut-Katanga). They then shot dead a university student.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 7 October 2020, a group of residents marched and barricaded some streets with rocks in Goma city (Goma, Nord-Kivu). They deplored the security situation in the city and expressed their outrage in reaction to an attack by unknown armed people the previous night, in which 1 man was shot dead, another injured and a woman was kidnapped. The police intervened and fired tear gas to disperse the demonstrators, who confronted the police and prompted some clashes. [size=no report]

On 7 October 2020, ADF militiamen armed with machetes and firearms killed 13 civilians (7 of them members of the same family) after breaking into their homes in the villages of Akwekwe, Mabuho-Mbimbi and Bayeyi, near Mamove village (Beni, Nord-Kivu) and close to the border with Ituri province. Five of the victims were killed in Mabuho-Mbimbi.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 7 October 2020, FARDC soldiers clashed with Mayi-Mayi Mazembe combatants in Mulendwa, near Munoli village (Lubero, Nord-Kivu), following an offensive by the FARDC. 1 Mayi-Mayi man was shot dead and others were wounded by the army. The FARDC, who seized a rocket launcher from the rebels, forced them to retreat.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 7 October 2020, FARDC soldiers clashed with 3 unidentified armed men who were robbing a motorbike in JTN village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). One of the armed men was killed by the soldiers, who recovered 2 weapons. The area is frequented by several militias.

column6: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column17: On 7 October 2020, FPIC militiamen abducted 1 civilian man in Bamara village, near Yombiabo village (Irumu, Ituri). The victim was accused of sorcery.

column6: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column8: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column17: On 7 October 2020, two groups of FPIC militiamen clashed with each other in Gandei village, near Mwanga (Irumu, Ituri), resulting in 1 fighter killed. The clash was triggered by a dispute after 1 of the groups had robbed goats from the local population.

On 8 October 2020, MPs of the Lamuka party coalition demonstrated in front of the national parliament in Kinshasa (Kinshasa, Kisnhasa). They expressed their refusal to a proposition to upgrade the town of Minembwe (Sud-Kivu) to a higher administrative level, which was seen as a threat to the territorial integrity of the country. This village, an enclave of long-standing ethnic related tensions, has a majority of Banyamulenge residents. [size=no report]

column9: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 8 October 2020, 18 armed Hapa na pale combatants, led by a man called Mundus, abducted 11 civilians (including 5 women) and 1 policeman near Mutuka village (Kabambare, Maniema). The victims were robbed and then released by the militiamen. The FARDC intervened later on to secure their release without clashes.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: On 8 October 2020, the FARDC clashed with Red Tabara armed men in the village of Nabombe (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu) following an attack by the state forces. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: RED-TABARA: Resistance to the Rule of Law in Burundi
column17: On 8 October 2020, the FARDC clashed with Red Tabara armed men in the village of Nandjale, near Nabombe village (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu), following an attack by the state forces. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 8 October 2020, CODECO militia combatants clashed with the FARDC for over 30 minutes in the village of Mbetchi, near Kasenyi (Irumu, Ituri), after these rebels had mounted an assault against an FARDC position. 5 CODECO rebels and 1 civilian were killed. The clash prompted a mass displacement of the population. Also, more than 400 cows were reportedly stolen by the assailants.

On 8 October 2020, activists of Lucha civil society group marched in Goma (Goma, Nord-Kivu) to demand the dismissal of the city's mayor. They accused him of incompetence in stopping the rise of violent attacks and the general insecurity in this town. [size=no report]
On 8 October 2020, ADF militia rebels abducted 4 civilians in Mangomba village, near Kisima locality (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

On 9 October 2020, a group of internally displaced people marched in Mbau locality (Beni, Nord-Kivu) against the repeated massacres by armed groups in the area. They called on the government to provide the FARDC with the means to put an end to the insecurity in the region. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 9 October 2020, the FARDC chased and clashed with militiamen who were robbing civilians near Tukumbe village (Shabunda, Sud-Kivu). 1 man was killed and another was wounded. The FARDC recovered 1 weapon.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) FDP People's Defense Forces
column9: CMC: Coalition of Movements of Change of the Congo
column17: On 9 October 2020, the FARDC clashed with Nyatura FDP armed men (under the CMC alliance) in Kiyeye village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), following a military operation. The FARDC drove the Nyatura out of this village. The FARDC then stole food and goods from the local population. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 9 October 2020, an improvised explosive device (IED) planted by suspected ADF rebels killed 1 FARDC soldier and injured two others while they were on patrol in Mapobu village (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 9 October 2020, a group of local men armed with machetes killed 1 FARDC soldier following a dispute between the soldier and 1 of these men in Bukavu (Bukavu, Sud-Kivu). [size=no report]

column6: FNL-N: National Forces of Liberation (Nzabampema Faction)
column17: On 10 October 2020, Burundian FNL (Nzabampema Faction) armed men kidnapped 3 men near Mwaba village (Uvira, Sud-Kivu). The kidnappers, who also stole money and goods from the local population, demanded a ransom for the hostages' release.
On 10 October 2020, suspected Mayi-Mayi Biloze Bishambuke armed men stole 82 cows during an incursion in Minembwe locality (Mwenga, Sud-Kivu).

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Mayi Mayi Militia (Nyatura) FDP People's Defense Forces
column9: CMC: Coalition of Movements of Change of the Congo
column17: On 11 October 2020, the FARDC clashed with Nyatura FDP (under the CMC alliance) in Rurama village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), following an attack by the FARDC. The latter drove the rebels out of this village and recovered 2 weapons. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Eco-Guards
column17: Around 12 October 2020 (as reported), an unidentified armed group killed a Bapela Eco Guard during an attack in Okapi, situated 45 km from Mambasa (Mambasa, Ituri).

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Naval Forces
column17: On 12 October 2020, Mayi Mayi militiamen clashed with FARDC naval forces in Buma, situated in Ubwari Peninsula (Fizi, Sud-Kivu). One FARDC soldier was reportedly seriously injured.

column6: FNL-N: National Forces of Liberation (Nzabampema Faction)
column17: On 12 October 2020, Burundian FNL armed men (Nzabampema Faction) kidnapped 8 people from a field in Karava-Nord village, 0.5 Km from Runingo town (Uvira, Sud-Kivu). The kidnappers, who also stole money and goods from the locals, demanded a ransom of 4,000 USD for the hostages' release.

column7: Labour Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 12 October 2020, more than 100 retired, widows and orphans of Bakuanga Mining Society started an open sit-in in Mbuji-Mayi (Mbuji-Maya, Kasai-Oriental), to demand for the payment of their pension by the company. [size=more than 100]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 12 October 2020, an unidentified armed group killed a civilian in the industrial area of Lubumbashi (Lubumbashi, Haut-Katanga).

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 12 October 2020, an FARDC soldier shot and killed 1 civilian man in Oicha locality (Beni, Nord-Kivu). No more details were reported.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 12 October 2020, eight civilians were abducted by an unidentified armed group in Kiliba (Uvira, Sud-Kivu).

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 13 October 2020, an unidentified armed group shot and wounded a police commander in the village of Magheria (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

On 13 October 2020, workers at Kilo Moto National Mining company held a demonstration and burned tires in Watsa (Watsa, Haut-Uele), to denounce the takeover of lands by gold mining company Kibali Gold Mines. [size=no report]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 13 October 2020, an unidentified armed group attacked the village of Mitando situated near Mutobo (Masisi, Nord-Kivu), killing one civilian and seizing cattle.

column6: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 13 October 2020, APCLS combatants clashed with patrolling FARDC soldiers in Mukohwa village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). The FARDC drove off the attackers. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
On 13 October 2020, NDC-R armed men (Bwira wing) killed 2 men in Lukweti village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). The victims were accused of collaborating with APCLS fighters.

column6: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 13 October 2020, APCLS combatants clashed with a mixed patrol of FARDC soldiers and NDC-R (Bwira wing) fighters in Kinyumba village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu), after an attack by the APCLS. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Fisheries Protection Unit
column17: On 13 October 2020, the Ugandese Fisheries Protection Unit arrested and tortured 27 fishermen from DRC near Nyakakoma (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), for having illegally crossed the maritime frontier in the Lac Victoria between the two countries. 8 engines and 5 small boats were also seized.

On 13 October 2020, clerks and court functionaries held a protest march in Ituri (Djugu, Ituri), to demand for the payment of their emoluments and compensation for the last ten years. [size=no report]

On 13 October 2020, lawyers of Tshopo province bar association held a protest march in Kisangani (Kisangani, Tshopo), to demand for the creation of a special international tribunal for Congo. [size=no report]

column6: UPLC: Union of Patriots for the Liberation of Congo
column17: On 13 October 2020, Mai Mai UPLC militants abducted an economic operator in the road between Mangurejipa and Butembo (Butembo, Nord-Kivu)

Around 13 October 2020 (as reported), a dozen residents held a sit-in in Rutshuru (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu), to denounce the bad conditions of the Parquet prison cells near the Peace Tribunal in Rutshuru. [size=a dozen]
On 14 October 2020, NDC-R Bwira wing fighters clashed with and killed one of their fighters in Kilambo village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu), also killing a civilian.

column17: Around 14 October 2020 (week of), a faction of CODECO militia occupied the Kilo-Moto district in the mining town of Mongbwalu (Djugu, Ituri). column17: Around 14 October 2020 (between 13 - 14 October), the FARDC clashed with an unidentified armed group in Mitando village situated in Mutobo area (Masisi, Nord-Kivu) .

On 14 October 2020, residents and social society activists held a protest march in Baraka (Fizi, Sud-Kivu), to denounce the decision to declare Minembwe a commune by the provincial assembly. [size=no report]

Overall, 4 FARDC soldiers, 1 NDC-R (Bwira wing) fighter and 6 NDC-R (Guidon wing) fighters were killed. 3 NDC-R (Guidon Wing) fighters were also captured. Fatalities coded across 2 events.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 14 October 2020, the FARDC and the NDC-R (Bwira wing) clashed with NDC-R armed men (Guidon wing) in the village of Nkingwa (Walikale, Nord-Kivu), after an attack by the FARDC-NDC-R coalition. Overall, 4 FARDC soldiers, 1 NDC-R (Bwira wing) fighter and 6 NDC-R (Guidon wing) fighters were killed. 3 NDC-R (Guidon Wing) fighters were also captured. Fatalities coded across 2 events.

column7: ECIDE: Engagement for Citizenship and Development
column17: On 14 October 2020, ECIDE political party held a protest march in Beni (Beni, Nord-Kivu), to denounce the creation of Minembwe commune by the provincial assembly. [size=no report]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 14 October 2020, an unidentified armed group beheaded a farmer in the village of Tsiti in Walendu Tatsi, situated in Djugu territory (Djugu, Ituri).

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 14 October 2020, CODECO militants attacked positions of the FARDC in the village of Liku situated in Djugu territory (Djugu, Ituri). 1 soldier was killed and another one was reported wounded.

column7: ECIDE: Engagement for Citizenship and Development
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 14 October 2020, police dispersed using tear gas a march held by the ECIDE in Kinshasa (Kinshasa, Kinshasa). They were denouncing the creation of the Minembwe commune, which they consider will divide the integrity of DRC. Some protesters were reported injured and other were arrested by the police. The Inter-Mutuelle Association of Southern Kivu (IMASKI) also held a protest sit-in in Kinshasa (Goma, Nord-Kivu) to denounce the creation of the Minembwe commune. [size=no report]

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: Around 14 October 2020 (between 13 - 14 October), Islamic State Central Africa province claimed an ADF attack in the village of Baeti situated near Mbau (Beni, Nord-Kivu). 2 or 3 civilians or FARDC soldiers (depending on the sources) were reported killed and several shops were burned.

column7: ECIDE: Engagement for Citizenship and Development
column17: On 14 October 2020, around 100 members of ECIDE party held a protest march in Kisangani (Kisangani, Tshopo), to demand for the creation of a special international tribunal for Congo. [size=around 100]
On 14 October 2020, Nyatura ""Abazungu"" militia men killed two teachers in Kalungu village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu).

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 15 October 2020, two aid workers from ""ActionAid"" international organization were abducted in Lweba (Fizi, Sud-Kivu) by an unidentified armed group.

On 15 October 2020, citizens gathered in front of the prison in Kalehe (Kalehe, Sud-Kivu), in order to find a policemen imprisoned and accused for the killing of a young men. During the protest, inmates were able to flee from the prison. [size=no report]

column9: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 15 October 2020, residents blocked the road N2 and torched the house of a policemen in Kasheke (Kabare, Sud-Kivu), to denounce the killing of a men the previous day by the presumed policemen. [size=no report]

On 15 October 2020, Raia Mutomboki Kabazimiya armed men clashed with Raia Mutomboki men led by Kikuni Jurist in Kakoga village (Shabunda, Sud-Kivu). The Kabazimiya group captured the rebel leader Juriste Kikuni and his 7 fighters. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

On 15 October 2020, dozens of activists of LUCHA civil society group and ""Je suis Beni"" group held a protest march in Beni (Beni, Nord-Kivu), to commemorate the sixth year of the Beni Massacres by the ADF and demand for justice. [size=dozens]

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 15 October 2020, police dispersed a march held by LUCHA civil society group in Goma (Goma, Nord-Kivu), who were demanding for the dismissal of the city's mayor for his incompetence. A dozen protesters were arrested during the police intervention. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: Around 16 October 2020 (as reported), the FARDC announced the arrest of the leader of Raia Mutomboki militia, Juriste Kikuni in Nyambembe (Shabunda, Sud-Kivu).

column6: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: On 16 October 2020, presumed FRPI militants ambushed a group of vehicles on the road between Boga and Bunia (Irumu, Ituri). One young girl was reported wounded.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 16 October 2020, five civilians were taken as hostages by an unidentified armed group in Mapera in the Butembo-Goma road (Goma, Nord-Kivu).

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 16 October 2020, residents burned a police station of Buholo Kasha in Bagira (Bukavu, Sud-Kivu), after individuals with police clothes killed a civilian in a robbery. [size=no report]

column6: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column7: Bira Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Hema Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 16 October 2020, suspected FPIC militiamen, a militia which claims to defend the interests of the Bira community, attacked the Bakakinda livestock market in Irumu centre (Irumu, Ituri) and killed at least 13 civilians, mostly from the Hema ethnic. The attack is linked to ethnic-based tensions triggered by militia violence, since the FPIC is accused of complicity with CODECO.

On 17 October 2020, citizens gathered to protest in the neighborhood of Himbi in Goma (Goma, Nord-Kivu), to denounce the death of a young girl caused by the convoy of the province's Vice-Governor. [size=no report]

column6: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column17: On 17 October 2020, FPIC militiamen burned houses in the village of Peka situated in Irumu territory (Irumu, Ituri).

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column9: Mayi Mayi Militia (Buhirwa); FNL: National Forces of Liberation
column17: On 17 October 2020, a group of Mayi-Mayi Kijangala in coalition with Mayi-Mayi Buhirwa and Burundian FNL armed men clashed with the FARDC in Sange (Uvira, Sud-Kivu), following an incursion by these militiamen to rustle cattle. The FARDC managed to drive the assailants out of the village. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column9: Mayi Mayi Militia (Buhirwa); FNL: National Forces of Liberation
column17: On 17 October 2020, a group of Mayi-Mayi Kijangala in coalition with Mayi-Mayi Buhirwa and Burundian FNL armed men clashed with the FARDC in Luberizi (Uvira, Sud-Kivu), following an incursion by these militiamen to rustle cattle. The FARDC managed to drive the assailants out of the village. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 17 October 2020, ADF militia combatants injured 3 FARDC soldiers after throwing 2 grenades during an ambush in Lese village, near Eringeti (Beni, Nord-Kivu).

On 17 October 2020, a group of local people blocked some streets in Bukavu (Bukavu, Sud-Kivu) to demand the collection of accumulated waste in a public square. The local authorities agreed to evacuate the waste hours later. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column17: On 17 October 2020, FARDC soldiers killed 5 FPIC militiamen in Irumu territory (Irumu, Ituri).

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column9: Mayi Mayi Militia (Buhirwa); FNL: National Forces of Liberation
column17: On 17 October 2020, a group of Mayi-Mayi Kijangala in coalition with Mayi-Mayi Buhirwa and Burundian FNL armed men clashed with the FARDC in Mutarule (Uvira, Sud-Kivu), following an incursion by these militiamen to rustle cattle. The assailants kidnapped 4 civilians and stole 2,000 USD from the local population before being driven out of the village by the FARDC. The latter chased the assailants into the forest to try to free the victims. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column7: Ebola Response Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Health Workers (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 18 October 2020, Ebola response health workers demonstrated in Bolomba town (Bolomba, Equateur) to demand their allowances for the last 4 months. They set fire to tires and barricaded roads while threatening other humanitarian workers attached to the Ebola response operations. [size=no report]

On 18 October 2020, 8 unidentified men set fire to the CDER party building (Current of Renovating Democrats) in Gemena (Gemena, Sud-Ubangi). Some members of this party managed to extinguish the fire and said that the attack was committed by a rival political party, without specifying its name. [size=8]

column7: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
column17: Around 18 October 2020 (as reported), a group of members of the UDPS party gathered in front of the national parliament in Kinshasa (Kinshasa, Kinshasa) to demand the dismissal of the Minister of Decentralization. They accused him of being responsible of the territorial conflict created in Minembwe (Sud-Kivu). [size=no report]

column7: Hema Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Bira Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 18 October 2020, Zaire militiamen, drawn from the Hema ethnic group, killed at least 11 civilians believed to be from the Bira Ethnic Group in Irumu centre (Irumu, Ituri), following an incursion by the Zaire militia. The attack was the response to previous ethnic-based attacks against Hema people by the FPIC militia, drawn from the Bira ethnic group.

column9: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 18 October 2020, a group of locals barricaded some streets with burning tires and looted one district office in Lubumbashi city (Lubumbashi, Haut-Katanga). They did it in reaction to the rape of a 14-year-old girl and the killing of 2 civilians by unidentified armed men the previous night. Some sources stated that these unidentified men travelled in FARDC military vehicles. [size=no report]

On 19 October 2020, around 50 teachers marched in Mbuji Mayi city (Mbuji-Mayi, Kasai-Oriental) to demand the dismissal of the Minister of Education due to the unpaid wages of teachers who fall in the category of new units, who have been working for years without getting paid. The rally followed a call for a strike across the country by teachers unions. [size=around 50]

column6: Bantu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Batwa Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 19 October 2020, local Bantu people clashed with Batwa people (both groups armed with arrows and edged weapons) in Monde village, 14 Km from Kabalo locality (Kabalo, Tanganyika). The clash took place after 1 Batwa man had gone to a Bantu village to collect mangos. Local authorities intervened to stop the fight. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column7: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress
column9: UDPS: Union for Democracy and Social Progress; Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 19 October 2020, a group of members of the UDPS party (supporters of Gabriel Ilunga) looted (and set documents on fire) the headquarters of the same UDPS party led by another leader called Blandard Tshimbombo in Kananga city (Kananga, Kasai-Central). The police fired teargas to disperse the assailants. The attack is the consequence of ongoing tensions within the provincial leadership of this party. [size=no report]

On 19 October 2020, hundreds of children aged between 7 and 10 demonstrated in Bukavu (Bukavu, Sud-Kivu) to demand their right to education after a strike called recently by teachers. They barricaded some roads with logs and burning tires and asked the teachers to return to the schools. [size=hundreds]

column7: NOGEC: New Generation for the Emergence of Congo
column9: Government of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 19 October 2020, young members of the NOGEC (New generation for the Emergence of Congo), a party associated with the FCC political platform, stormed and looted a public Revenue Office in Makola village (Lubao, Lomami). They did it in response to the call of their leader to boycott provincial institutions amid tensions with the presidential UDPS party. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column9: Journalists (Democratic Republic of Congo); Prisoners (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 19 October 2020, a group of FARDC soldiers on patrol arbitrarily arrested 1 journalist of a local radio in Mongbwalu town (Djugu, Ituri). He was then beaten and tortured by the military, who also took his belongings.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 19 October 2020, unidentified armed men shot and killed 1 man and shot and injured his wife in Goma city (Goma, Nord-Kivu).

column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 19 October 2020, Nyatura militia rebels clashed with the FARDC in Kashuga village (Masisi, Nord-Kivu) following an incursion by these rebels. 3 civilians and 1 rebel were killed by the FARDC. The latter also arrested 1 Nyatura commander called Sore Kabiriwe.

column7: Teachers (Democratic Republic of Congo); Students (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 19 October 2020, a group of members of teacher unions and a group of 20 students of primary education demonstrated in front of the ministry of education in Kinshasa (Kinshasa, Kinshasa) against the unpaid salaries of teachers and the insufficient funds. The students demanded their right to study. The teachers called for an indefinite strike across the country, to be held on Mondays and Tuesdays. [size=no report]

On 19 October 2020, several dozen workers of the City Council demonstrated in Lubumbashi (Lubumbashi, Haut-Katanga) to demand their unpaid salaries. Reportedly, some of them had not been paid for over 50 months. [size=several dozen]

On 20 October 2020, primary and secondary students demonstrated in Kikwit (Kikwit, Kwilu) to claim their right to education after the national strike called by teachers. They gathered in front of the Town Hall where they asked for urgent measures so that the teachers return to the schools. [size=no report]

On 20 October 2020, primary and secondary students demonstrated for the second straight day in Bukavu (Bukavu, Sud-Kivu) for their right to education after a strike called recently by teachers. The children burned tires and barricaded some roads and asked their teachers to return to the schools. [size=no report]

column6: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 20 October 2020, the police clashed with unidentified armed men while artisanal miners escaped from a mining site in Luoyi village, 0.5 Km from Rubaya town (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). Overall, 3 policemen were killed and 1 was wounded. 3 of the armed men were also wounded.

On 20 October 2020, a group of local taxi drivers demonstrated in Kibirizi locality (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu) to show their outrage in reaction to the killing of a fellow taxi driver by militia combatants. [size=no report]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 20 October 2020, unidentified armed militiamen ambushed 1 policeman and his motor-taxi driver in Mutanda (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu). The assailants shot and killed the driver and kidnapped the policeman. The area is frequented by various militias.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-) Prison Guards
column9: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column16: AFP; Reuters; Radio Okapi; BBC News
column17: On 20 October 2020, a large number of ADF Islamic militants (claimed by the Islamic State) clashed with prison guards and FARDC soldiers during a coordinated attack by these rebels against the central prison and an adjacent military base in Beni town (Beni, Nord-Kivu). At least 2 prisoners were shot and killed and more than 1,500 were freed by the assailants (mostly ADF and Mayi-Mayi combatants). Only around 100 inmates stayed in the jail and 20 returned later that day. The Islamic State claimed later that 7 FARDC soldiers were killed and many more wounded, but this information had not been confirmed.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 20 October 2020, unidentified armed men kidnapped 8 women during an incursion in the Ndosho district of Goma city (Goma, Nord-Kivu). They were taken towards the area of the Virunga National Park, within Nyragongo territory, where various militias operate. The assailants later asked for an 80,000 USD ransom for the release of the victims.

column6: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Mayi Mayi Militia (Android); Mayi Mayi Militia (Makanika); Banyamulenge Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Babembe Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Banyindu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Bafuliru Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column16: AFP; La Prunelle; La Libre Afrique; Twitter
column17: On 20 October 2020, a coalition of Banyamulenge militiamen from Ngumino, Twiganeho, Android and Makanika groups clashed with Mayi-Mayi militiamen drawn from Babembe, Banyindu and Bafuliru ethnic groups in the village of Ibumba (Fizi, Sud-Kivu), after an incursion by the Banyamulenge. At least 19 people were killed, including 17 combatants and 2 civilians. Fatalities coded across 3 events.

column6: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Mayi Mayi Militia (Android); Mayi Mayi Militia (Makanika); Banyamulenge Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Babembe Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Banyindu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Bafuliru Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column16: La Prunelle; Twitter; La Libre Afrique; AFP
column17: On 20 October 2020, a coalition of Banyamulenge militiamen from Ngumino, Twiganeho, Android and Makanika groups clashed with Mayi-Mayi militiamen drawn from Babembe, Banyindu and Bafuliru ethnic groups in the villages of Kabuchangwa, Bwarara and Rebera, all near Ibumba village (Fizi, Sud-Kivu), after an incursion by the Banyamulenge. At least 19 people were killed, including 17 combatants and 2 civilians. Fatalities coded across 3 events.

column6: Ngumino Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column7: Twiganeho Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo); Mayi Mayi Militia (Android); Mayi Mayi Militia (Makanika); Banyamulenge Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column9: Babembe Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Banyindu Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo); Bafuliru Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 20 October 2020, a coalition of Banyamulenge militiamen from Ngumino, Twiganeho, Android and Makanika groups clashed with Mayi-Mayi militiamen drawn from Babembe, Banyindu and Bafuliru ethnic groups in the village of Kashasha, near Minembwe village (Fizi, Sud-Kivu), after an incursion by the Banyamulenge. At least 19 people were killed, including 17 combatants and 2 civilians. Fatalities coded across 3 events.

On 21 October 2020, more than 20 teachers demonstrated in various schools in Butembo (Lubero, Nord-Kivu) during the strike called by leading teachers' unions in response to unpaid salaries by the government. [size=more than 20]

column7: Batwa Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 21 October 2020, 1 militia leader from the Batwa Mayi-Mayi Hapa Na Pale agreed to surrender with his 100 men and hand over their arms to the FARDC in Mukumbi village (Kongolo, Tanganyika).

On 21 October 2020, suspected ADF militia combatants killed 2 civilians during an attack in the Lyakobo area of Beni town (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The assailants were believed to be part of the fugitives who escaped Beni's central prison the previous day.

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 21 October 2020, unidentified militiamen killed between 5 and 13 men in Mwalika village (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The victims were prisoners who had escaped the jail in Beni the previous day, after being freed by an Islamic militia.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 21 October 2020, primary and secondary child students demonstrated for the third straight day in Bukavu (Bukavu, Sud-Kivu) for their right to education after a strike called recently by teachers. The children burned tires and barricaded some roads and asked their teachers to return to the schools in front of the governor building. The police fired tear gas against the children and dispersed them. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 21 October 2020, the FARDC clashed with NDC-R armed men (Guidon wing) in Luvungi locality, near Mpofi (Walikale, Nord-Kivu), following an operation launched by the state forces. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
Around 21 October 2020 (as reported), a group of local people lynched 1 man in Karhabisha village, near Kavumu (Kabare, Sud-Kivu). The man was accused of being a kidnapper. [size=no report]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 21 October 2020, unidentified armed militiamen clashed for over 30 minutes with the FARDC in Kiliba village (Uvira, Sud-Kivu), following an attack by these rebels against an FARDC camp. 1 FARDC soldier was killed.

column6: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
column8: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
column17: On 21 October 2020, the self-appointed Colonel Emmanuel Rugema, a leader of the FDLR-RUD militia, was killed by his own men in Katwiguru village (Rutshuru, Nord-Kivu) following an internal dispute for power.

column6: FPIC: Patriotic and Integrationist Force of Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column9: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column16: La Prunelle; Radio Okapi; AFP; Africa 1; Actualite
column17: On 21 October 2020, FPIC combatants clashed with the FARDC and the police in Irumu centre (Irumu, Ituri), following an attack by these rebels. 1 FARDC soldier, 2 policemen and 2 civilian women (relatives of the military) were killed by the assailants. 4 FPIC rebels were also shot dead. 1 policeman was shot and injured. The attackers set on fire the local police station and the public territorial office.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column9: Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo); Women (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column17: On 21 October 2020, a group of local people lynched 1 woman in Kavumu (Kabare, Sud-Kivu) accused of being a kidnapper and having killed a 7-year-old child. The police intervened and opened fire to disperse the group, killing 1 civilian. In response, some people attacked and killed 1 policeman with machetes. 4 other people were also shot and injured by the police. Property damage was also reported. [size=no report]

On 21 October 2020, suspected ADF militia combatants killed between 5 and 12 civilians during an incursion in Mbilali village (Beni, Nord-Kivu). The assailants, believed to be part of the fugitives who escaped Beni's central prison the previous day, looted several goods from the local population.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column17: On 22 October 2020, CODECO militia rebels killed 1 pastoralist in Zambuti village, near Kasenyi (Irumu, Ituri), following an incursion to rustle cattle.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 22 October 2020, CODECO militia rebels clashed with the FARDC for almost the whole day in Mbogu village (Irumu, Ituri), after these rebels had attacked this area and had stolen around 100 cows. The FARDC killed 4 rebels and captured 2 others, recovering also the stolen cattle.

On 22 October 2020, a group of students attacked and injured 1 teacher in Luizi village (Nyunzu, Tanganyika) after knowing that they did not pass the national school-leaving test. The police intervened to keep the teacher safe. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column8: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
column17: On 22 October 2020, the FARDC clashed with FRPI (Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri) militiamen in Nyamugamba village, near Kamatsi (Irumu, Ituri), following an offensive launched by the FARDC. The latter killed 1 rebel and managed to recovered around 400 cows this militia had rustled. [size= no report]

On 22 October 2020, a group of teachers and parents marched in Goma city (Goma, Nord-Kivu) to demand the government to take the measures so that teachers, on strike to demand unpaid salaries and better conditions, return to the schools. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 22 October 2020, the FARDC clashed with the NDC-R (Guidon wing) in Utunda village (Walikale, Nord-Kivu). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 22 October 2020, the FARDC clashed with the NDC-R (Guidon wing) in the villages of Tweno, Kembe, Luvungi Kasuka and Brazza, all near Utunda village (Walikale, Nord-Kivu). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 22 October 2020, the FARDC clashed with ADF combatants in Kwele village, near Kainama locality (Beni, Nord-Kivu), following an ambush by the FARDC. At least 15 ADF rebels were killed by the military and 5 civilian hostages were freed (3 of them were injured during the crossfire). Around 10 rebels were captured, including the wife of one of the leaders of this armed group, Jamil Mukulu. The army also recovered several weapons and other equipment.

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 23 October 2020, CODECO militia rebels clashed with the FARDC in Mbogu village (Irumu, Ituri) for the second straight day, after a new incursion by these rebels. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 23 October 2020, the FARDC clashed with suspected Mayi-Mayi Mazembe militiamen in Kiavirimu village, near Musindi village (Lubero, Nord-Kivu), following an operation by the FARDC. 2 Mayi-Mayi were killed and some weapons were recovered by the army.

column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 23 October 2020, a group of artisanal miners demonstrated, vandalized and looted the facilities of a mining company in Musonoi town (Kolwezi, Lualaba), in reaction to the killing of 2 fellow miners by the police after they trespassed on the mine for digging. The police intervened to disperse the miners by firing into the air and the latter confronted the police by throwing rocks. [size=no report]

column6: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
column8: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 23 October 2020, 4 unidentified armed militia combatants clashed with the police in Baraka town (Fizi, Sud-Kivu), following an attack by these rebels against a police station. 2 police officers were shot and injured and one of them died in the hospital later.

column7: LUCHA: Fight for Change; Macho Macho
column17: On 23 October 2020, activists from Lucha and Macho Macho civil society organizations demonstrated in front of the government provincial building in Lubumbashi city (Lubumbashi, Haut-Katanga). They demanded the authorities to take measures to revert the insecurity in this city, including improving the conditions for the state forces. [size=no report]

column6: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 24 October 2020, the FARDC clashed with suspected Mayi-Mayi Mazembe militiamen in Kanzanza village, near Musindi village (Lubero, Nord-Kivu), following an operation by the FARDC. At least 1 Mayi-Mayi was killed and some weapons were recovered by the army.

On 24 October 2020, a group of lawyers marched in Gbadolite town (Gbadolite, Nord-Ubangi) to demand the deployment of more judges in this province and increase the rotation of the magistrates to deliver better justice. [size=no report]
On 24 October 2020, a group of construction workers of a Chinese company demonstrated in Tshikapa (Kamonia, Kasai) to demand their unpaid salaries for the last 4 months. [size=no report]

column6: CODECO: Cooperative for Development of Congo
column8: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
column17: On 24 October 2020, CODECO militiamen clashed with the FARDC in Bunia town (Irumu, Ituri), following an incursion by these rebels. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.
Protesters blocked roads in Benins main city Thursday to demand a second postponement of this weekends presidential vote amid allegations that a million people were left off the electoral roll.
Hundreds of opposition supporters protested in front of Benins electoral commission on Wednesday following weekend presidential elections, claiming vote results were mishandled.
Benin authorities on Thursday fired tear gas to disperse youths protesting the re-election of President Boni Yayi in recent polls after they refused to clear roadways, police said.
Journalists marched through the streets of the capital to demand the right to exerce their proffession in a secure environment.

An Italian-owned tanker, the RBD Anema e Core, was attacked and boarded by suspected pirates yesterday (24 July) in the waters off the coast of Benin. The attack took place approximately 23 nautical miles south of the country's commercial capital and largest port of Cotonou. The Anema e Core was carrying a cargo of fuel and was manned by a crew of 23, including 20 Filipino seamen, when it came under attack by a group of at least three suspected pirates.
Pirates boarded a Swedish tanker off the coast of Benin at the weekend but were chased away by the African nations navy, leaving the vessel and crew unharmed, the ships owner said Monday.
Pirates seized a Cyprus-flagged tanker with 23 crew on board Wednesday off the coast of the West African country of Benin, the latest in a wave of such attacks, the International Maritime Bureau said

Hundreds of Togolese refugees admitted to the camps of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) in the town of Agame, Benin, a hundred kilometers from Cotonou, have demonstrated outside the political representation of the organization in Cotonou. Benins Interior Minister Benoit Degla HAD Asked Togolese Refugees to return to Their Country if They Are Not Satisfied With Their living condition in Benin.
In recent days, producers of cotton basins of North Benin march against the Interprofessional Cotton Association. Precise date(s) and location unknown. The event occurred in ""north Benin.""
An American is kidnapped in Benin. Location, date and perpetrator vague. He was found in the Mono department.
A pro-government march tokk place in Parakou in support of the president, Boni Yayi
An anti-government protest march was stopped by the police
